Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2/5/2014 yellow session. First beer of the day! Thick black treacle viscous pour with a relucant tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, raisin, soft roast. Flavour is massive brown sugars, figs, raisin, tart cherry. Full bodied, smooth palate, viscous on the tongue and light mineral chalk. So much depth of flavour. Verry very smooth. Some wood and tan leather.

just realized havent rated this before. Rating based on 2013, though an off year still an incredible beer. Pour is pitch black and thick with a burgundy mocha head which settles quickly. Aroma is dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, cinnamon, and pepper..in a good way reminds me of Dr Pepper. Taste follows suit matching the aroma with all flavors blending well throughout the palate - love the slightly tart umami quality in the mid palate, bitter chocolate in the finish, the pepper is perfectly done with prominent flavor and only a hint of heat.Palate thick and chewy sticking to the glass and the tongue. Amazing beer even in an off year.

2014 bottle. Pours deep brown/black with some slight tan head, caramel bordering...head fades quickly. Aroma is cinnamon, faint espresso and milk chocolate. Taste is like a chocolate cinnamon roll sprinkled with mild chili flakes. Cinnamon, vanilla and chocolate all very present along with the warming chilies in the background. Adds volume and kick without ever being spicy. Just an amazing mixture of awesome here.

2013 bottle. Tastes like dark chocolate, licorice and molasses. The chiles and cinnamon arent very present anymore. Leaves a lingering dark chocolate bitterness. Great beer, but I would like to try it fresh.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of mint, coffee, chocolate, weak sweets and spice. A flavor of chocolate, mint, coffee, spice, roasted malt and some very weak chili notes?
Pours black with a small cocoa brown head. Aroma is cinnamon, peppery barbecue and rich malts. Taste is cocoa up front with spicy peppers and cinnamon kicking in for the mid and finish. Really nice.

Pours dark black like oil with some tan head. Chocolate, some grain, a little coffee, and some sweetness on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a nice roasted character. Very good, very complex stout.

This beer was as close to perfect as I have had. I taste all the flavors in waves, chocolate, vanilla and chili spices. The pour was thick like used motor oil and I sipped it slowly, savoring every drop. Unfortunately I only got one bottle of Hunahpu and I can only hope to come across another one in the future.
Bottle..Pour is dark black with thin white head..Nose is chocolate, spice, roast, raspberry..Taste is berries, spice, chocolate, roast..Nice and smooth for the alcohol

Smooth and fascinating smooth. Chocolate, malt, roast. Plums. Extreme deepness. Great!! 
14/14/14/14

2014 bottle, generously shared by Ferris. Thick black oily pour with a finger of mocha head. Aroma, vanilla, cinnamon, coffee, and roasted malts. Taste, thick mouthfeel, some sweetness up front, followed by some roast, finishes with a big wallop of spice. Overall, solid RIS, very unique, and not really like any RIS Ive had before, lots of different things going on in the flavor, but it works.

750ml brown bottle, bottleshare at Ferris. 2014 bottle. Black pour, short and frothy tan cap. Spicy nose, rich chocolate notes. Taste has spices and chocolate and roast. Peppery finish with some heat.
Bottle - Cinnamon, dark malts, chocolate and almost like horchata. Jet black with a brown head. Spices and a nice light heat, chocolate and cocoa. Heat on the throat, very nice.

750 ml bottle. Bottle shared at Huhzubendah tasting 9/25/11. The beer pours a true black. Light dares not pass through the viscous liquid. The head is dark tan/light brown, and the lacing is ample. Aroma is massive: an inviting combination of cocoa and chiles that brings to mind mole sauce. Oak and vanilla notes are also present, along with roasted malts and booze. Flavor is same, with cinnamon and roast in addition. Mouthfeel is thick and rich, and is clearly one of the great beers of our time. A favorite of mine. From notes 9/25/11.

Sample at CBC.
Pours pitch black with a brown head.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, spicy taste, cinnamon, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, licorice, dry finish.
Very complex and smooth. (2014-05-02)

On tap at CBC 2014.
One of the best stouts to date!
Thick and rich. Lots of chocolate and vanilla. Also has some unique spice notes, which give this beer a really interesting characteristic.
Which they brewed more of this one.
On tap at CBC 2014, vintage 2014. Black with tan head. Aroma and taste of lemon, spice, chocolate, coffee, lime, lemongrass, alcohol and more chocolate

Roasted malty, chocolate, coffee, caramel,vanilla, complex on the palate. Gorgeous.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. First tick of the festival - and a big one, for sure! :-) Pours a deadly syrupy black body with a tiny caramel brown head. Nose is cocoa, chocolate, syrup, mild coffee, cinnamon, vanilla, hints of Norwegian brown cheese, coca-cola and licorice. Taste is caramel, cocoa, vanilla, Norwegian brown cheese again, cinnamon, mild chili, hints of herbs and roasted coffee. Thick, oily body, soft to medium carbonation. A complex heavyweight which truly delivers! :-)

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours black with a brown head, aroma of grain, chocolate, coffee and liquorice, flavor of liquorice, cocoa, cinnamon and nutmeg, medium to full bodied, Great.
Sampled at Dark Lord Day 2014. Near black with a tan head. Nose of roasted malts, chocolate,vanilla, and coffee. Bold in body. Flavor is rich and there is a chocolate finish. Really nice beer.

On tap at CBC 2014: version 2014. On tap at CBC 2013 versions 2011,2012,2013. Black with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, coffee, spices, vanilla. Sweet and bitter taste more or less like the aroma. I liked 2012 version more than 2011 and 2013 because it was more spicy and I liked very much the 2014 version which had these spicy notes along with delicious aroma and taste of fresh chocolate and coffee.
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. does live up to the hype, wow that chocolate

Taster, draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, first session. Patchy surface. Dark brown body. Dark spiced aroma with honey sweetness. Rum like taste, dry and sweet, fat chocolate and dark spices to the ending with warming alcohol. Full bodied. Lovely, best taster so far at the festival (02.05.2014).

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2015 Tap @cbc14. Pours black with big mocca bubbles around. Aroma is roasty and quite grassy. Herb like freshness. Lacing. Taste is dark chocolate, sweet and notes of coffee. Then some peppery herblike and dry long toasty finish. Amazing with so much freshness for a all black beer.

Re-rate cbc15. Still awesome, loads af blackberries, nice spice, cinnamon, more fruity by the aging, cherries and coffee berries.

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has dark fruits, caramel, some alcohol, spices, roasted malts and chocolate. Taste has roasted malts, chocolate, some caramel and a medium bitter finish. Over medium body and soft carbo. Nice stuff.

Sampled & thanks to (in absentia) JulienHuxley, bottle released 03/2013, ended up in front of me @ ZBF 2014-ZA. Pours an expected unctuous pitch black with mocha head. Aroma and taste emanate a truly Floridian "Bam! Kick it up a notch!" approach towards density in favour of complexity, displaying a horror vacui where no harmless taste bud is left behind, being mercilessly seal-clubbed by a savoury dark hole radiating vanillated coffee, crema, dark fudge, dark chocolate and an extra helping of coconut and oreotic goodness. With its smooth, creamy and lush palate, this is a gorgeous coffee dessert, yet a bit of a soulless beer - cf. its near-lack of a yeast profile. Rating it from an anthropologists perspective as a bewildering and probably pricey café frappé-chocolate float offering instead.

Bottled @ Zeebra #2, small sample. Had this beer couple of times before, but never rated it. Pitch black color, fluorescent brown head. Slight fruity aroma, strawberry, together with heavy roasted malts, hint of vanilla, coconut. Very bitter and malty, chocolate, cookie. In the finish it has the spicy and peppery bite of the chillies. Very thick mouthfeel. Awesome beer!
Wow, what a great beer. Full and rich taste of coffee, cacao and vanilla, all nicely balanced. Very, very good.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Great! Sweet, but not sugar-sweet (like dark lord, for example). More vanilla, noga, fudge, caramel sweet. Great richness. Absolutely love this beer!

Edit: rated lower after drinking it at Borefts 2014, not that expressive.

Tap. Opaque black body with an average,lacing, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and slightly bitter and with alcohol. Full bodied, oliy texture and soft carbonation. A world class Impy.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een volle mooie bruine kraag. Ruikt kaneel, speculaas, specerijen. Smaakt vol, specerijen, speculaas, koffie en iets gebrand. Bittere afdronk.
Pours a pitch black beer with a nice brown head. Smells dried fruits, rye, cinnamon, spices. Tastes rye, caramel, cinnamon and roasted. Very nice. Thick body, low carbo and a sticky texture.

Draught @ CBC 14
Aroma has porto, alcohol, some cocoa and nuts. Flavour is spicy with honey, peppery tones and dark chocolate. Also some coffee tones. Spicy and nice, might take a while to finish a whole bottle.

Sample glass at ZBF 2014 thanks to someone at the table. black beer, brown head, aroma is sweet and something i cannot recall, taste is coffee and chocolate, and aftertaste is chili sting... 2011 was better than the 2013
@ZBF. Thanks to JulienHuxley for sharing. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, alcoholic, vanilla, caramel. Taste is sweet, vanilla and caramel.

Thanks to JulienHuxley. 2011 & 2013 bottles side-by-side @ ZBF 2014. 2011: Pours an oily black with a thick mocha head. Smells of thick oily mocha, warming, thick coffee, cacao, vanilla, thick black chocolate, caramel, touch milkchocolate. Tastes of thick rich coffee blended with black chocolate, toffee, touch vanilla, mocha, cacao, plenty of molasses, light chilli in the back but it is barely thick, warming, sludgy with iced coffee, thick coffee, spices, lingering taste. Very thick body. 2013 is similar but less depth, less nuance, less complexity. Very nice but nowhere near as mind-blowing as I had expected, coming from the Apple Brandy & Stranahan versions, this is good but the BA versions is what you really need to have.

beige head that disappears without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. taste is like aroma with a spiciness that builds up but is never overwhelming. every sip is a new sensation, very complex and well balanced. abv very well hidden. really awesome and for a change a beer that lives up to its hype ... hurray!

The 2012 and 2013 versions from two 0.75l bottles neck to neck @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Hehe, thats kinda nice.. I immediately notice that the 2012 has a stronger and wider aroma than the 2013. Its/theyre undoubted what I will describe as black in the glass(es) and it/they has/have a/some nice little sidesticking dark brown chocolate head(s). I get chocolate, wood, some bourbon and delicious sweet vanilla on both of them, but in addition the oldest one has a nice coffee acidity to it. Not hard to tell the difference here, but both of them smell(s) amazing. Creamy as the smoothest cream with a lovely comfortable and spot on almost tingling carbonation level. Tons of espresso coffee and cocoa in the taste. And the chocolate is almost a bit to much for me (well, not really). Noticing that the 2013 is a pitch sweeter and the the vanilla is more present it the youngest. It/they end(s) with a clear stingy chili bite on the tongue(s?) as its/theyre gently gliding down the throat. I have to say that there is a substantial difference in the two vintages going on here, but Im not in the arguing mood, so Ill just agree with me and myself that this (these) is/are an/some amazing brew(s). Cause he/she/it/they it/ really are. 03.05.2013

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 If you would like to smell & taste cinnamon, soja, salt, cacao, banana, licorice - go ahead this is your beer. This is a very balanced beer, with many layers. Great mouthfeel. With every sip, you discover something new in flavour. Finally an American beer that lives up the hype.

Bottle share thanks to drewface. Not sure it was worth lifting the couch and helping him move but whatever. Nose is spicey with some cinnamon. Pours a pitch black with a dark tan head. Taste is a cinnamon dominant slightly spicey taste. Pretty freaking awesome.

Yeah I gave it a 5 and realistically I cant think of a reason NOT to give this beer a 5. Jet black pour with a small tan head. Aroma is incredible, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa, subtle chile pepper, molasses, and caramel. Flavor is like a cinnamon roll with notes of chiles and cocoa. Its so complex! The abv is completely hidden too. This beer really and truly deserves the reputation it has surrounding it, it was even better than I was hoping for! Now to just try and get another bottle...

2014 Bottle thanks to bartender matt at the tasting room. Pours dark black with a tan head. Smells of pepper and a lot of cinnamon. Taste is a cinnamon bomb. The spice is in the back end. So smooth though. 2011 and 2014 are the two best years. But you better love cinnamon.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

bottle shared poured a dark brown color with no head. the initial aroma was cinnamon, roasted dark malts, notes of vanilla and other spices. the flavor I almost fell out of my chair. it was incredible. the roasted malts and the spices blend so well...alcohol well hidden in this one. incredible beer. no wonder its so hard to get.

I had the first bottling of this beer and it was fucking delightful. Full aroma of burnt caramel and chocolate with head colored the same. Tastes of fudge, more burnt sugar, coffee, balancing booze. What a winner.
Taste at Beercraft. Pours a thick black color without much head. Lots of cocoa flavor with a hint of sweetness. Warming sensation.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Bottle from weezel in a trade. bottle to glass. Pours a rich dark black with a creamy brown head. Leaves a small lace ring around the glass. Aroma of chocolate, and spice (cinnamon?). Some chili also. Taste is sweeter than I expected. Chocolate, sweet malt, and that cinnamon spice. I fell a bit of heat. Extremely creamy mouthfeel. Perfectly carbonated.

2013 bottle to snifter. Pours thick and black. Aroma of peppers and vegetables. Pepper and sweetness in the flavor. A little spice as it gets very warm. Smooth carbonation. A little velvet. Very sticky. Underwhelming.

Pours jet black with a nice dark brown head. Huge lacing. Woody and peppery vegetal aroma. Flavor is very complex - mild cinnamon, very slight spiciness, rich chocolate flavors. It all fades into a great aftertaste that one would expect from a great imperial stout. Overall fantastic stuff - Abraxas is a bit better in my opinion but only marginally so

Sample at Ale Alpharetta. Pours black, with a minimal, dark head. The aroma is vanilla, cinnamon, some roasted peppers, and dark chocolate. The flavor is very sweet, with just a little bitterness, and a good, mellow, well-balanced spiciness. Very heavy body, thick, smooth, and creamy. Overall, this is a nicely done, flavorful, thick, and reasonably spicy stout.

Bouteille 750 mL (millÃ©sime 2014). Brune-noire opaque, mousse brune faible. Nez lÃ©ger de cacao, surtout marquÃ© par la cannelle. Bouche sirupeuse, commence par chocolat noir et un soupÃ§on de vanille, puis mÃ©lasse et tire Ã©ponge avec forte concentration de cannelle qui sÃ©tire jusquÃ  une finale persistante oÃ¹ le piquant de la cannelle se mÃªle Ã  du piquant pimentÃ©. Unique et intÃ©ressante.

Bottle shared with northropfrye. Beautiful motor oil in appearance. A get a lot of soy sauce in the aroma, but also coffee and chocolate. In the taste I get coffee, chocolate and tamarind. This is a fascinating beer and Im really enjoying it.

Thanks thiessenace for this rare one! Much appreciated! March 2013 bottle sampled in March 2014. Dark body with velvety brown head, not a lot of lacing, head dissipates fairly quickly. Looks a little silky rather than the syrupy thick element you get with some imperial stouts. Aroma of bread, sweet malts, raisins, tomatoes, hickory and mesquite barbecue. Taste is definitely on the sweet side, though nicely balanced with roast cocoa and some spices that I cant identify. Taste lasts on the palate but its not particularly lively. Abv quite well masked. Overall an excellent imperial stout. Glad I finally got a chance to try this one.

Thanks to Krista and Eric who brought this back from Hunahpu day. Black with dark brown head and lace. Cocoa brownie woody hop cinnamon pepper aroma. Chocolate roasted coffee ripe dark fruit vanilla burnt toasted bread with peppery dry roasted coffee medium bitter finish with some lingering heat from the pepper. Very full body. One of the heaviest beers Ive had in while. Low carbo. Fucking incredible.

Thanks to pushkinwow for this. Pours inky black with a small brown head. Aroma is chilis, intense roasted malts, dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste is intense roasted malts, dark bitter chocolate, chili in the nose and up front but fades in the aftertaste. Alcohol is very prevalent and good legs on the glass. Superior beer.

Opaque black, brown lacing. Chocolate, chili pepper, cinnamon, brown sugar, a bit of vanilla, and some coffee. Moderate sweetness sitting on peppery spiciness. Smooth and full bodied, with black coffee bitterness in the finish.
Drank off tap at Hunahpu Day. The 2014 version has some incredible layers to it. The chocolate, cinnamon, and coffee stand out. I like it a lot more than the 2013 version. Great beer.

1 yr old bottle, Pours thick black with low head, and a thick residue on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and roast, taste is big time roast with nice sweet chocolate up front and a light chili finish. very nice

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Black with tan head. Aroma is cinnamon and fruity spice. Taste is full bodied - very fruity. Orange tangelo pudding. Spicy finish. Feel there are lots of similarities to mulled wine here. Overall, a true original. Maybe too much citrus fruit for me. UPDATE...Cracked a 2014 bottle May 2015 - tasting a lot less citrus and more balanced with the spices. Extremely good stuff!

This years version might be the best they have made. Despite everyone claiming such a bad time the event was still pretty fun. 

Sweet spice of licorice and cinnamon hit you up front and the coffee and chocolate follow through. A sweet almost brandy life flavor shines though with a long lasting finish. Really good.

750ml bottle, shared by caterwaul. This bottle has an incredibly high fill. Probably the highest I have ever seen. It was pretty much all the way to the cap. Seems like an old bottle judging from the appearance of the mouth of the bottle. Some dry beer bits around the mouth of the bottle, cap looks kind of funky. Alden says it smells a little oxidized. Before picking up the glass even, its fair to say that this is an older bottle. Pretty much pitch black color, thin light brown head. Some loose splotches of lace. Some good legs, a nice film on the glass. Good spicy cocoa peppery aroma. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, moderate to bigger sweet. Light kick. Bigger body. Chewier, thicker, creamier carbonation. More dry finish. Lighter carbonation. Awesome, spicy, complex imperial stout. Good thick chewiness to this. Very nice to try. Probably an older bottle though, not that theres any hints of oxidization. I just wonder if this might be more flavorful if fresh. Very complex and aromatic as it is, though. I really enjoy the spiciness. Light dark fruitiness. Good stuff.
Unique beer! Chocolate and coffee in the nose. Spicy on the palate. Tastes like Vanilla beans, chocolate, coffee and peppers. Nothing like it!!
750ml bottle pours a dark oily black with a small tan head. big chocolate vanilla and slight chili malt taste. great stout
Black with dark brown head. Aroma is spices, chillis, peppers and chocolate. Taste is chocolate, licorice and chili peppers. Thick and creamy, sweet and a clean finish.
Tasting with Dak. Black pour with a ring of tan carbonation. Aroma of sweet cream, chocolate, tart dark fruit. Flavor is more of the aroma with huge lingering coffee, vanilla, chili on the finish.

2011 bottle that I have no idea when I got in a trade. This is definitely a big, bold imperial stout. Slick and oily mouthfeel adds to the overall effect. Really cool looking pour, jet black but with some ruby red highlights as it thins. Almost no hint of the 11 ABV. I really didnt get much from the chilies but that might have been due to the age. Tasty.

Bottle 2011. Pours black with burnt foam head that recedes quickly leaving a slight lacing. Aromas of cocoa with cocoa the primary taste followed by peppers and a hint of vanilla on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle courtesy of Armin. Pours a dark brown...near black, but the light exposes some copper hues. Smell is robust. Caramel, vanilla, tobacco, dark chocolate and faint chili peppers. Taste is loaded with chocolate, roasted nuts, vanilla sweetness, tobacco, spices and faint peppers. Very well balanced. Very nice and oily mouthfeel, slightly sticky. So very well done. Love this beer!

2012- bomber. Pours dark thick and viscous. First taste is smooth but full of complex flavor. As it warms more subtle notes of the chillies. I'd love a tad more vanilla but for the abv it's incredibly well balanced. Much better than the 2011 bottle I had previously.

Poured from a 2013 bottle. Color is an opaque black with a thin dark head. There was a slight ruby tinge to the head, but barely noticeable. Aroma is chocolate, cinnamon, and spices. Taste was a complex and well balanced. Definitely one of my favorites.

Bottle thanks to Sparky! Pour deep black. Aroma is peppers, roasted coffee, sweet chocolate and spices. Taste is vanilla, peppers, spices, roasted coffee - this keeps changing with every sip. This bottle was aged and this beer is best fresh.

2012 bottle poured into tulip: pours black with a tan head. Aroma of cinnamon and chocolate. Taste is chocolate, smoke, cinnamon, and bit sweet. Theres a lot going on here, but its all awesome. Full body, really thick but not cloying. Great beer. So good.

From a trade with cpetrone84-thanks, Chris! 13 bottle, drank in Dec. 13. Viscous, oily pour. Deep black. Vanilla, dark chocolate on the nose. Incredibly smooth and creamy mouthfeel with flavors of vanilla bean, touch of soy, dark chocolate that lingers and lingers in a very long finish. Palate is just so plush. Been wanting to try this forever and did not disappoint.

Bottle, 2011 vintage thanks to Adam. Pours a viscous oily black with no residual head. Aroma of molasses, dark chocolate, tobacco. Big, chewy mouthfeel. Pretty heavy bitterness starting midpalate through finish. Pepper heat is sensed, but is fairly subtle, probably lost with the age.

Vintage 2011

A: Pours obviously quite thick - crude oil. Broken, dark mocha foam coats the surface and then dissipates nearly immediately. No residual foam. No lacing. The beer coats the walls of the glass and tans the window.

S: Plenty of vanilla. Plenty of earthy and spicy chiles. The ancho chiles are more evident than the pasillas, but nonetheless, the chile is there. Anise and licorice notes are also there, and IMO, more prominent than the cocoa. 

T: Dark chocolate truffles laced with salt, chile and vanilla. Decadent. Very sweet and sticky. The beer is not particularly complex, but the ingredients are fairly balanced in here. Ive read that the chiles are the fastest dying aspect of the beer - Ill buy that. The cocoa is at the forefront of the beer, but the chiles offer the counter to the sweetness albeit subtly. The vanilla flourishes in the ol factory aspect of the palate. Theres bitterness which is predominated by the malts IMO. 

M: Sticky, tacky, viscous, chewy. I really cant use enough adjectives to describe how thick and alive this beer feels. The thickness is only interrupted by the fine, sharp carbonation. Theres no visual indication that this beer has carbonation, but the feel is spot on the for the style. Finish is dry and mouth watering. 

O: Theres no question this is a fantastic beer. Does it live up to the hype? Almost. A little more from the chiles and I would say yes. I cant see the benefit of aging this in barrels. The bottle size is a bit too much for one, but would be great for four folks as a digestif.

Serving type: bottle

05-13-2011

2013 bomber. Glugs out of the bottle, thick and black. Very sweet. Slight peppery cinnamon. Some chocolate. More cinnamon as it warms. Tastes like it would be a good christmas stout. No doubt that this was good, but not the 14th best beer in the world.
Pours black with thin beige head. Smell is sweet mocha. Hazelnut caramel, chocolate and some pepper. Good stuff

Pours really pitch blck, with a very dark foam. Looks absolutely amazing.
Nose is chocolate, some peppers and smokey. Taste is amazing, really complex with lots of chocolate, vanilla and a nice peppery feel to it, which really does the trick on this beer.

Catching up on old ratings. 

One of my all time fav imperial stouts. Always delicious. A dark and complex beer. The pour was jet black with khaki head. Aroma was chocolate, chiles, honey, cinnamon. Taste was even more chocolate and cinnamon. Nice heat from the chiles which really make this beer stand out from other imperial stouts. Especially when balanced with some vanilla, toffee, and bourbon sweetness. Wonderful, creamy thick mouthfeel. A winner.

Opaque black color, small firm brown head. Tobacco, sweet cigar aroma, light black peppery notes. Full-bodied. Cocoa, pepper, cigar-tobacco, perhaps hints of vanilla. Very complex and enjoyable

Sweet chocolate and honey to the nose. Pours black and thick and settles with a fine thin off white collar. Slick to the mouth boasting of cocoa, sweet vanilla, and honey. Almost too sweet but backs off at the finish with a hint of spice from the Ancho chilies. I cried when I first drank this nectar of the gods.

Bottle, thnx to NorCalGrowler, shared with friends, 2011 vintage. Pours a pitch black beer with a thin beige head on top. Aroma is sligtly peppery, chocoalte, molasses, oak and quite boozy. Really nice and full of layers. Flavor starts off sweet with touches of chocolate, vanilla and coco, body has some peppery feel to it and finishes with big barrel characteristics and boozyness. Again, very complex and flavor is being built up very well. Awesomely brewed beer, cant wait to try the BA versions of this.. Epic!

Good choice for 700. Great chocolate and espresso aroma from the brown head. Body was actually light on the palate for such a big beer. Roasted and black malt flavor finished dry. I was expecting to be blown away by this beer, but it was just a better than average Imperial Stout. Hope to have it again so I can compare.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2014 shared a bottle with 2 close friends. wow... this was something special! poured verry thick like motoroil. with a small tan head. smell is a bit sour. but the taste... WOOW! chilis. vanilla, cacao, roasted chocolate. verry smooth mouthfeel. with a nice and dry finish. allmost perfect beer! would love to dry the barrel aged version of this one! never had a beer that tasted that special!
Bottle from International Trade; dark brown pour with thin tan head, roasted malt aroma, taste had big chilli taste which overwhelms the other delicate flavours, a hint of vanilla roasted malts.

Tasted at GABF. The 100%, beyond a doubt highlight of the night. Pours jet black. Hints of vanilla, cinnamon, and spice. The three flavors blend with the creaminess of the stout really balancing the spiciness from the chili. I could drink this all night long. Perfect.
Chocolate, soy sauce, roasted coffee on the nose. Tastes of roasted marshmallow, soy, dark chocolate, and smoky ancho. Thick and creamy on the mouth with a wet finish. Excellent stuff.

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Brown Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Cocoa, Hot Peppers, Dark Chocolate

T: Cocoa, Mildly Heated Peppers, Dark Malts, Mild Brown Sugar

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mild Heat, Mildly Sweet

Overall, a great balance of the cocoa nibs and ancho chilies, melds so well together.
Tap.GABF. dark brown, brown head. Smelss of roasted malt, dark fruit and caramel. Flavor is sweet fruits, caramel, roasted malt and chocolate.
UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 750 ml bottle shared during GABF week.  Black with a brown head. Dark chocolate, vanilla, light cinnamon, a touch of pepper. Smooth slick body with a sweet finish.

Pours out midnight black with very little head. What is there is a luscious chocolate color.

Dark chocolate and vanilla are the dominant aromas, however the chiles make their presence known the more the beer warms.

Tastes lean a bit toward the sweeter side, which I usually dont like, but it never became cloying. Good flavors of rich dark chocolate dominate the palate. A touch of vanilla and oak as well. Chiles werent detectable until it warmed to room temp, but then asserted their presence to add some complexity without overpowering anything else. Very good balance.

Viscous and thick without becoming cloying. Carbonation level was fairly low.

A good beer that become an amazing beer once it reached room temp as the chiles really came out to add a unique complexness to this. The dark chocolate flavor that was persistant throughout was the highlight for me.

Consumed alongside a Tatuaje FF 2013 and Askinosie 72% Tanzanian Chocolate at Just for Him, Springfield, Missouri, shared with several friends. 7-12-13.

A- Poured into HF stemware, pours jet-black with a thin mocha head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the glass. Appears to be very thick, almost syrupy, with very low carbonation. 4.25

S- Vanilla beans up front followed by unidentifiable spices, cherries, chocolate, several fruit esters I cant pick up, with a slight alcohol undertone. Extremely complex and enjoyable. 4.75

T- Chocolate that is quickly overtaken by a strong, yet not overpowering chili flavor that gives way to marshmallow-like vanilla, cinnamon, and a complementing roast malt. There is a lingering bitterness, it seems like it is more from the malt than hops though. 4.5

M- Low carbonation that is barely present, a full body with a long bitter note mixed with the heat from the peppers. 4.5

O- This beer is definitely better around 50-55 degrees. All of the flavors seem to pop more and meld to make an incredible beer. I dont know if I could drink much more than 12 ounces of this in a sitting, but it is very enjoyable, and one of the best Russian imperial stouts I have consumed thus far. When you pick it apart individually as far as smell, mouthfeel, etc, it doesnt rate as high as it deserves. Simply incredible, I will be searching for more.

Bottle, shared by Kevin L - Thanks! Pours thick, nearly black syrup with minimal mocha head. Aroma of dark fruit, alcohol, cinnamon, chile pepper, maybe some licorice. Wheres the chocolate / coffee / roast I expect from an imperial stout? Retrospectively, this shows me what Fremonts 1st Nail was shooting for. Taste: Lots of cinnamon and spice; chocolate and roast, coffee in the finish. Damn, the back end on this is fantastic, with some spicy pepper on the end. Full body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Overall: love the taste on this, especially on its back end. The nose is something of a letdown, but the taste more than makes up for it. Great brew, glad I got to taste this.
Not a current year release which I heard is better. Poured black with dark tan head. Light spice choc aroma. Similar drying choc spice taste.

2011 bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium tan head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is a strong roast, cocoa and chiles. Thick mouthfeel with strong roast, dark chocolate, light pepper in the finish. Hides alcohol well, really enjoyed this one.

750ml bottle (3/09/13). Shared by dmac. Why? Cause hes the kind of guy that just opens baller beers for no reason. Thanks bro! Pours a rich thick black color with a finger of dark chocolate foamy head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, vanilla, and chili peppers. Taste of sweet chocolate, caramel, hints of vanilla, roasted malt, and some chilis in the aftertaste.
2011 vintage. same bottle as Matt. yup, tasted like Dales Marinade, or a more rounded soy sauce. will be curious to see how the other years are.

Trade med "Hayta" (thanks man!). Drar den parallellt med Bells expedition stout. Humor att en i sällskapet säger att dom båda är precis lika bra, vilket dom just nu rankas som på RB. Håller jag dock inte med om. Den här är snäppet vassare. Lite för dominerad av kryddor hörs också. Även där håller jag inte med. Precis lagom kryddad. Underbar. Subtila chilitoner. Når upp till hype och höga förväntningar.

bottle from 2011 trade with Ughsmash. good aroma, sweet, chocolate, minor soy, little smoke. dark orangy brown color, small head, little to no lace, though I poured it slowly. Sweet bitter flavor. Heavy body, thick oily creamy mouthfeel, sweet bitter finish. Tasty, cant believe Ive sat on this until now, well not sat on, but held in my fridge, ha ha. flavor and mouthfeel are wonderful . Aroma tad mellower, nice thanks Ughsmash
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 Pours like soy sauce. Smells smokey. Tastes smokey and potent. Its different.
2011 2012 and 2013 vintage at CBC: Jet black with a nifty brown foam. Taste is spicy, with coffee and chili notes. Also some cinnamon. 2012 vintage prefered.

Bottle at CGBD. Pours black with a brown head. Roasted malts, fudgey chocolate, vanilla, and just the faintest hints of pepper heat in the finish. I dog the restrained pepper, Id definitely have like it a lot less if it was much more than this. Big and rich. Good stuff.

2013-08-17. Black body with modest tan head that fades. 3+ Aroma of cocoa, chocolate and chilies, 7+ Flavour is similar, sweet rich malty core, with cocoa, mild peppers grow as you go. 6++ Smooth medium bodied palate, low carbonation. Glad to try it but ultimately pretty disappointing. The peppers are less intense than they could be but it just does not do it for me. Bottle at Campground Brewdown.

Bottle, 08/11/2013. Pours black, deep mocha tan head, dies to a few hazy splotches on the surface, thin ring of lacing. Aroma is fluffy cocoa brownie, toffee blending with spiced vanilla, cinnamon, moderate chili heat mixing ,with roast finish. Taste is sweet chocolate caramel, pepper heat. cinnamon vanilla, dark roast finish, heavy bitter and coffee, lingering heat from the chiles grows with more sips. Thick body, very rich. Great.

Really amazing. Sweeter than other stouts. Super complex. Chocolate and chilis come through. Easy drinking. A beautiful beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Such a great, full bodied taste. This is one of the best beers you can try to get your hands on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What an unbelievable imperial stout. Deep dark, chocolate, smoke, wood. Just enjoy!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 Pours a very nice looking opaque, very dark brown with a smooth mocha colored head. Dark chocolate, smoky olive, and chili flesh on the nose. Mouthfeel is coating and moderately thick, like a melted milkshake. A bit of capsicum tingle on the tongue after the finish.  Rich flavor of dark chocolate, smokiness, and olive, with some vegetable cutting into the richness and blending for a mildly tart cherry at the finish.

2012 bottle. Emerges as a thick and gloopy dark black liquid with a great brown head that settles to a thin ring. The aroma reveals itself in layers. First dark, ashy malts come through, followed by chilli, then vanilla shows itself. Eventually it all becomes mixed together to smell a bit like a band-aid, but the chillis just seem to get more and more powerful. Huge milk chocolate taste with pepper heat following it up and a hint of vanilla behind it all. Elements arent so layered here; everything feels well integrated but each sip is very similar and it does get a bit tiring. Massively thick and oily mouthfeel. The only drawback of the hugeness is that its tough to work through. Oh, and I couldnt really detect cinnamon at any stage, but theres just so much going on here that Ill forgive it.

Did a vertical of Hunahpu with year 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013 Hunahpu bottles. 2010- pour dark black. aroma of spices, cinnamon and chocolate. Taste vanilla, cocoa, cinnamon and a good amount of spices. Love it. 2011- pour motor oil black. I was surpise 2011 did not have a punch of spices as 2010. The nose did have alot of vanilla. Taste was Choc, cinnamon and vanilla. 2012- pour black. Aroma was of more cocao and vanilla. Spices did come back but it was not as much. 2012 also has a peppery flavor to it as well. 2013- still very much fresh had all the aroma. Cinnamon, chocolate, vanilla, heat from the peppers and it tasted as such. Over all I think the Hunahpu beers is fantastic and if you can get your hand on a bottle get one. My favorite out of all the years is the LOL... BA Huna. If you can get a BA Huna get it!
UPDATED: SEP 8, 2013 Good god this awesome. Super awesome palate and look. Taste is very chocolate forward. Overall, this would be amazing in barrels.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Released on March 9th, 2013. Courtesy of GandGKevin. Thanks Kevin! Black bodied with a thick, frothy brown head. Aroma is peppery with strong roasted malt, cocoa, dark chocolate and vanilla notes. Taste is strong roasted malt, cocoa, dark chocolate, vanilla, molasses, light peppery notes, hints of cinnamon and chocolate cake. Soft brownie notes as well. Full bodied and chewy with a creamy, dense carbonation, light warmth from the alcohol and peppers, and mild sugary stickiness. Finishes with soft, warming pepper notes, cinnamon, dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, chocolate cream cake and cookies. Damn tasty!

Bottle, shared with John. From Nicole. Aroma of cinnamon, roasted malt, charred wood, sticky sugar. Superb mouth feel - creamy and smooth. A whirlwind of crazy flavors. Smoky chilies and cinnamon stand out over the deeply roasted malt. Lots of chocolate too. Think Mexican Hot Chocolate. Sweet but just a faint acidity on the back end. Outrageous.

Black gold. Everything a stout should be- perfectly balanced malty flavor blends coffee and chocolate with just the right amount of alcohol on the lingering finish. Savoring the bottle slowly over the course of a day highly recommended.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 So glad to get to try this. Thanks very much to Mike (mwbrady12) for trading me this one. This beer is right up my alley. I love chili stouts. The pour is quite viscous and black with a brown head. The flavors/aromas change and come out as it warms. There is aroma of chocolate, some cinnamon, roasted malts. The taste is complex and roasty. Sweet upfront with a dark chocolate bitterness followed by a big chocolate flavor and finally a slight chili burn. The mouth feel is like oil. This beer is a complete meal.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2013 Bottle with some chill bros in Dallas, thanks yall!! Pour is thick viscous oily black with a small tan head and amazing lacing. Big roasty, chocolatey, cinnamon, vanilla sticks, woody, chili peppers, nutmeg, espresso, and somewhat nutty aroma. Taste is rich dark chocolate, sweet vanilla, amaretto, cinnamon, lightly spicy, sweet malty, roasty, coffee, and peppery with a sweet and spicy finish. Thicky syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Such a rich and decadent beer and so damn smooth. I could chug this stuff which is scary.

06/07/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà, 750ml bottle shared by Manuele Colonna (thanks Manuele!). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma leggerissima color cappuccino, molto scura, poco persistente. Al naso sentori di cacao, liquirizia, vaniglia, cannella, alcol, reminiscenze di bourbon. In bocca è un minestrone caotico di liquirizia, cacao, vaniglia, peperoncino, cannella, legna, astringenza, alcol eccessivamente presente. Corpo pieno, lunghissima, consistenza oleosa-cremosa, carbonazione soft. Violenta, pacchiana e sgraziata.

This is a great beer don't get me wrong. Because of the whole one day release thing I think it gets a lot more hoopla than deserved. Still I love to share with my best friends in my hunahpu imperial stout snifters. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle shared by Adam Jackson, thanks bud! Vintage 2013. Yeah, I understand the reason people stand in line for this. The mouthfeel very viscous. The ABV is totally hidden at 11%. All the flavors are amazing and really what can I say that hasnt been repeated 300 times? Rich chocolate cake, chili pepper (without much heat) , vanilla bean is also subtle. All the flavors meld well together. I feel like letting this sit for some time to build the complexity is a must. Yet as a young bottle it still crazy good.
[bottle] Black, with a deep, deep brown head. Coconut sweetness, some smoke, yet the overall beer is quite smooth. Soft tobacco. Dark chocolate. Spices. Lovely, fantastic balance [21062013]

Bottle - Pour black as night with a brown head. Lot of viscosity in the body, it coats the glass like oil. Lots of chocolate, cinnamon, and spices in the nose. Tastes of chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, and some heat from the chili peppers (not a lot but perfectly balanced). This beer is awesome and I love it.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2014 Poured from the bottle. Looks are pitch black with a brown head. Aroma is dark bitter chocolate and coffee. Taste is strong dark chocolate, hint of coffee with pepper coming in at the end. This is one great beer.

Bottle, thanks Mike. Black with dark brown head. Ineresting aroma, spices, chillis, peppers, chocolate, something sharp. Taste has lots of coconut, chocolate, licorice and chili peppers. Thick and creamy, sweet and a clean finish. Delish, a unique and interesting beer.

a - pours thick opaque cola  with almost no head (too cold). No lacing. S - strong notes of toasted malts up front. This is taken over by rich dark and milk chocolate, notes of cinnamon, chili powder, cacao, vanilla, baked crust, pungent raisins. Charred oak, leather, and vegetal malts. M - dry Chalky texture. Strong body, with a full palate. T - taste follows the nose. Toasted malts and charred oak up front. Mince meat  pie, raisinettes, raw cacao, toffee, peanut brittle?, and dark chocolate on the palate. Lingering bitter dried grasses, chalk, and burnt caramel end.  Pepper gets much stronger as it warms. O - nice, but drier, more bitter than I'd hoped. Too burnt. Darkness and dark lord were much better. 4.1

Bottles of both '12 & '13. The pour is dark. The aroma sweetness an a lot of malt. The taste is also a lot of malt. The drink is thick. Finishes a little heavy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark black with brown head. Aroma is boozy with dark bitter chocolate and some coffee. Lots of peat, tons of dark chocolate and a little coffee on the tongue, with some pepper coming through late. Awesome beer.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and spice.

750ml bottle in a snifter.  Pours black with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, some light peppers, and a light bitterness.  Flavor the same, with a smooth malt character and the added ingredients all blending well.  Thick texture.  One of the best beers Ive had.

Bottle at Endos house, 25/05/13, thanks to Jason for securing this from the source.
Mid black with a big billowing dirty tan head - this looks the bollocks!
Nose is dark malt, chocolate, leather, demerara sugars, vanilla, pinch of spice.
Taste comprises chocolate, dark malt, vanilla, spice, hint of chilli pepper, sugars.
Full body, slightly viscous, smooth on the palate.
Great stuff, ticks all the impy boxes, alcohol kept in check and not overly sweet.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: bottle share at hill farmsteads pre-3rd anniversary. pours pitch black with a minimal beige head, some lacing. roasted malts, burnt chocolate, dark cocoa, blend of spices - cinnamon, cardamom and chiles come through, tingling spices, earthiness and tobacco. boozy and cloying burnt molasses. soft carbonation, full body - very syrupy, bitter coffee and smoky but cloying finish. a sipper but i enjoyed it. not only original but components blend well together.

Pours a pitch black with little brown head and no lacing. Aroma of decadent chocolate, sipces, light coffee. Taste is full of chocolate, cinamom, light chili notes, roasted. Full body and low carb. Really enjoyed this one

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Bottle.  Huge thanks to mikem409 for this one. Pours a super silky black with a small, very attractive dark brown head.  Aroma is chocolate up front, coffee, chilies, a little cinnamon.  Taste is medium-heavy sweet, mild bitter; lots of cinnamon coming through, chocolate, and some nice flavors from the chilies as well.  Finish is sweet, roasty with a slight bitterness, and a small burn from the chilies.  Full bodied, insanely smooth, soft carbonation.  This is excellent stuff, and possibly my favorite imperial stout to date.  Im really glad to have tried a relatively fresh bottle.  Thanks Mike!

Bottle @ CBC 2013. (2013 ed.) Pours black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla, hard roasted malt, flowery hops, peppers, chili, cedar, smoke, cocoa, licorice, cinnamon and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Body is full, texture is smooth, and carbonation is soft. Finishes malty sweet with chili burn.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 Amazing pour. Thick, dark molasses head.  Fizzles down pretty quick. Smell is overwhelmingly chocolate and mild chile.  Ancho chilies come through predominantly with tart dark chocolate taste. Lingering dry chocolate flavor on the palate. Finish is cocoa with light vanilla tannins and more cocoa. Good, not mind blowing, but I prefer the Marshal Z.

Copenhagen Beer Celebration.
Tap, 040513.
Black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavour complex with dried fruit, coffee, liqourice and chocolate

Received in trade from cpetrone84, thanks for the opportunity Chris.
Pours a thick solid black color with a decent sized long lasting dark cocoa head. Smells of chocolate and roast up front with lots of anise and dark sugars supporting. Light cinnamon as well as earthy hops provide a bit of balance. Thick chocolate syrup, dark chocolate, licorice, nutmeg and cinnamon flavors come out up front. Lingering chocolate covered pitted fruits, licorice and roast coats the digestive track long after every sip. Thick body with a creamy syrupy mouthfeel and a light level of carbonation. This is a big thick sweet chewy stout, just the way I like them, bring on the diabetes.
2013 vintage.  Really underwhelmed.  Reminds me of Dark Lord.  Strange tart flavor.

Poured from a bottle.  Nice thick and creamy brown head that lingered longer than expected for a beer of this ABV.  Smells of chocolate, caramel, coffee, and a little bit of vanilla.  Sweetness dominates with cinnamon, vanilla, and caramel hitting the tongue first with a bit of roasted barley at the end.  Cant tell for sure, but there might be peppers in here balancing everything.  A great and complex Imperial Stout.

Bottled 2012 sample at CBC 2013, Saturday evening, deep dark brown with a lacing beige head, leather and tobacco aromas, syrupy texture brings roasted dark chocolate, malt extract and hints of coffee and gravy. The aftertaste is burnt with chilli coming through.
Sample @ CBC 2013. Dark brown with a small brown head. Malty with coffee tones. Malt, coffee and chocolate. Full body with a long bitter / spicy after taste.

Pours black with a minimal tan head that eases away into nothingness. Aromas are powerful cinnamon, clove, chocolate, coffee, toffee, nutmeg, roast, and light alcohol. Flavors are massively spiced with cinnamon, clove and nutmeg being the most forward, lots of cocoa and toffee mingle with the spice, there is a soft pepper heat that is more felt than tasted although it does come through in flavor on the aftertaste and very minimal alcohol notes that are quite pleasant. Palate is perfect in every way, thick and creamy with tongue coating supremacy. Overall this is an amazing experience though one to be savored for sure; the beer is big and complex and can easily overwhelm the senses but it is a truly exceptional drinking experience.

[5/4/13] Bottle at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. 2011 bottle. Opaque black with a brown foam film. Aroma of dark chocolate, some espresso, liqueur and a bit of spiciness. Sweet flavor with dark chocolate, liqueur and a slightly spicy finish with a bit of burnt malt, light bitterness and a bit of alcohol. Full-bodied, silky mouthfeel. Great stuff.

Vanilla stout goodness. Strong sweet aroma. Solid stout, not roasty base. Strong vanilla notes. I like it -- recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 and 2011 bottles at CBC.
Pours heavy black.
Lots of chili but yet fairly balanced. The 2011 vintage is more chcolatey and drinkable.

How could a beer this good have such a shitty label. It looks cheap like somebody half assed their way through Photoshop and printed it off at home. OK, my apologizes for criticizing what is otherwise one of the best beers that Ive ever had in my life. Ive had a lot of Imperial Stouts in my day and this is probably the best one that hasnt seen any wood that Ive ever had. I wouldnt want any wood here either. They manage impeccable balance of a huge roasty Imperial stout with cinnamon and ancho chile I believe. This is just delicious. Goes down too easy. Fantastic. My favorite beer of the night and we had some great ones.

CBC. Vintage 2012. Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla and alcohol. Flavor is is quite sweet and rather biter.Dry and rather bitter finish. Smooth. 030513

Vintage bottle 2011, 2011, (2013) at CBC 2013 cons 2013-05-04 Cophenhagen - the 2011 is judged!
AR: rich dark, licorice, coffee
AP: thick black fluid, transparent coppery head 
F: rich dark, licorice, coffee, + chilli - super duper

thanks thomas.  2013.

poured a thick oil like viscosity.    taste of cocoa powder and nib.  slight cofee, hazlenut and almond.
Bottle @ CBC. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, thick, little liquorice, hop, medium sweet and  medium bitter.

Pours opaque black with small deep brown head. Smell is deep rich malt, soy, alcohol. Taste is the sweet rich malt countered by lots of char, chocolate, coffee and a little chili on the aftertaste. Roasty char and dry aftertaste. Body is rich and thick. A great Impy stout!

Bottle at CBC.
2011:
Black colour with dark brown lacing. Roasted, coffee aroma, with some vanilla. Roasted and licorice taste, with alcohol warmth. Very dense, full body.
2012:
Same as the 2011 version, but with more dark fruits (raisins) in aroma and taste
2013:
This one is sweeter, with more dark chocolate. Also more bitterness.
Sample @ CBC 2012 version. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice and hops. Nice and dry.

Sample at CBC 2013, Friday. (I tried vintage 2013 and 2011) This rating is for vintage 2011.

Black with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of light spices, roasted malt, licorice, dried fruit, some chocolate and "milk". Nice smooth mouth feel and with a long aftertaste. Not the best Imperial Stout but still a very nice beer.

Bottle  @ CBC. 2011 vintage. Pours pitch black with small brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, light coffee, rich dark chocolate, caramel, light pepper. Flavor is rich roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, ripe plums, spice, light cedar, little alcohol. Full body, soft(almost flat) carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. 030513
Sampled at CBC 2013. Black with a beige head. Intense chocolate aroma,some peppery notes. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.

Zeebra Extreme Beer Festival - Black, no head. Oily look. Vanilla is dominant in the aroma with some light cinnamon in the background. The initial taste is of cinnamon with a prickly background heat that becomes quite warming. Overall, too much cinnamon.

Flaska på CBC 2013. Smakade en 2011 och en från 2013. Smak och doft av mycket choklad, portvinskänsla.
2011 var  pepprig med toner av  russin. Fyllig och rund. Med en bitterchokladbeska.
2013 var mer stickig med smak av saltlaktris och brända toner.
Riktigt bra båda två. Lagring gör ändå stor skillnad, roligt.

Acquired in a trade for a bolt cutter at dark lord day. Hunahpu bottled march 2013 poured into snifter. Pours thick black with small dark tan head. Aroma is cinnamon, char, dark fruits and vanilla. Taste is much of the same. Imo cinnamon dominates the palate with this brew. Lots of cinnamon up front and in the finish. A bit of vanilla with a very faint touch of the chile peppers. As it warms vanilla comes out a bit more. Overall I was very happy to have tried such a well sought after brew. While I think it was quite tasty, I think the cinnamon is just a bit too dominate in this stout. Cant wait to try one aged a year.

Samples @ CBC (2011& 2013). Pours black with a golden beige head. Notes of molasses, olives(!) and milk sweetness in aroma. Taste is spicy and chocolaty with a touch of honey. The ancho is a problem to the balance (espacially in the 2013 version).

2012 vintage at CBC. The appearance is just simply through the roof. Pitch oil black, with a small dark brown head. Some aroma of chocolate, roast, vanilla, some wood, many things going on here. Very full bodied, long both roasty and bitter finish, with a tiny dash of sweet. Fantastic!

Sample from bottle at CBC 2013. En 2011 och en 2013. En stor maffig imperial stout. Massiv kropp, den unga är betydligt kärvare med brända smaker, chili, peppar och saltlakrits. Den äldre är rundare med mer choklad, russin och antydan till portvin. Båda är riktigt bra och förvånansvärt olika efter två års lagring.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 (Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.) Awesome experience having 11.12.13 cintages side by side. Epic brew!

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 ZEBF13 , 2013 edition ( of the beer, AND the festival )
pours black, no foam. smell is peppery, soft carbo, realy sweet, peppery, thick. chocolate, bitter... nice! 

Re-rate after drinking it 3-4 times. Sometimes it just sucks ( to high on cinnamon, for one thing ) sometimes its great and complex. Guess vintage matters in this one. Lowering the score from 4,2 to 4 .

at Zeebra Extreme Beer Festival 
Head: almost nothing 
Colour: pitch black 
Smell: chocolat, bourbon vanilla, small notes of coffee and roasted malts 
Taste: WOW superbly brewn stout ! ts been a long time since ive had a stout where ive thinked of WOW this ones nice !
Very nice balance of Coffee, Chocolat and Vanilla as well as hints of the Anchos nothing too peppery perfectly balanced with nice bitter/sweet levels, superb !

Poured pitch black with a small tan head.. Aroma of roasted dark chocolate malt, roast coffee beans and some liquorice. Full body, flavour as per the aroma with some saltyness and vanilla smoothness. Dry, bitter chocolate end.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2014 Pours black with oily tan head. Aroma of chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla, light coffee maybe but Im going to go with apple pie. Taste is sweet, brandy barrel and and vanilla. Body is thick and oily with nearly flat carbonation.

Pours dark dark low brown head
Aromas coffee powder, dark malts, taste is typical imp stout sweetness, bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose is coffee, vanilla, dark fruits, brown sugar, honey. Taste is quite similar and supremely balanced with toffee, some liquorice and chili.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from box
aroma, wow deep malts, really deep chocolate oaky sweet esters, amazing
coclor, dark brown, slight foam head, very low carbonation, thick
taste, chocolate esters, strong malts smooth though very smooth..., awesome drinkablity, a sweet strong gluide on the taste buds
overall, I love it, cant get it here, but I would thats for sure, may have to hit up a trade for this!
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text:
75 cl bottle @ CBC13. 2013 vintage.
Pours pitch black color with a small beige head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, cocoa, dark chocolate, licorice, some salmiac and oat. Some mild rye and syrup notes too. Flavour of roasted malts, harsh dry chocolate, cocoa, some syrup and tar. Not overly sweet and has quite harsh malty body. Very complex and full-bodied. Excellent.
4317

750 ml bottle @ CBC2013. 2012 vintage. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, cinnamon, burnt bread and licorice. Flavour is very strong with roasted malts, cinnamon, coffee, salty licorice, gingerbread and hay. Full bodied, oily mouthfeel and a roasty, spicy and heavy finish. Really unique when compared to the other top imperial stouts. Excellent stuff.

750ml bottle @ CBC 2013
2012 vintage - Pours pitch black with a sticky brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, spices, vanilla, ash, smoke and cocoa. Taste is roasty, smooth, warming and spicy with peppery notes, vanilla and cocoa. Finish is smooth, chocolatey and spicy with peppery notes and vanilla. Nice, extremely well balanced imperial stout with a nice touch of spices. Great stuff.

13 Bottle - thanks Homer321! Pours inky opaque black with one of the darkest heads I have seen, although it lightens a little as it sets. Head formation is secondary, but eventually a small to medium creamy head is formed that leaves nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, a touch of cinnamon. No pepper on the nose for me. Flavor is the same but there the pepper and cinnamon take front stage, mixed together in a lightly spicy melange, a bit like Mexican Coffee, perhaps. Medium sweet, light to medium bitter. Full body, oily rich mouthfeel. A nice beer for sure, but a bit too much on the spices for me.

Jet black, creamy layer of foam rests on top, good lacing. Chocolate aroma with a hint of cinnamon, or something spicy anyway. Cinnamon definitely comes through in the mouth along with cocoa and vanilla. A bit of ash bitterness towards the end. Not tasting the Chiles. Nice balance of sweet up front, bitter on the end.

Bottle: Poured a deep pitch-black color stout with a medium size deep brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of deep velvet chocolate notes with light spicy notes and some light vanilla and cinnamon can also be detected. Taste is a mix between some deep chocolate notes with light cinnamon and vanilla a with some residual sugar notes with dry bitter notes subtle finish. Body is full with limited filtration and with a smooth texture with almost motor oil-like consistency. Extremely complex while retaining a good level of drinkability. I found it very hard to do justice to this beer as I am missing work to explain how good it is.

Bottle share at DLD. Chili, chocolate, and light smoky aroma. Black with a small tan head. Fruity chili, chocolate, and coffee flavor.  No significant chili heat. Full viscous body. The fruity pepper flavor in this one had a great distinctive flavor that I found very difficult to describe.
Pours dark brown. Aroma of spice. Cinnamon vanilla and Chile. Lingers a bit but not cloying. Poured at dark lord day.

Thanks Adam. 
Oily black with no head. Rich chocolate caramel wood malts.  Rich and inviting.  Chocolate roast a little sweetness and fruit.  Rich and creamy.  8/4/8/4/16

Smells of mild peppers with undertones of cinnamon and pours a thick black color that produces a thin red/brown head that quickly disappears.  It tastes of roasted peppers with mild hints of cinnamon, and cocoa; leaving the palate with a creamy sensation. This was an amazing beer that left me wanting more.  Thanks Daknole for the experience!

Aroma of spice, roast, coffee, green pepper, and caramel.  Pours soupy black with a creamy brown head.  Taste is super sweet with cinnamon, chocolate, poblano, marshmallow and slight coffee.  Very complex and strange but this totally works.  Great stuff.

The best over the top imperial stout Ive encountered.  It balances the high alcohol with enough chocolate, roast, and chiles to balance.   I would not, however, age this beer, as the flavors that balance the alcohol will mellow with age; leaving a raisin-like off taste.

Back log. Enjoyed at a tasting with some local beer buddies 2 weeks ago. Good Lord!! This was fantastic!! Tobacco on the front. Cinnamon, vanilla and pepper start to take over as it warms. Absolutely stellar beer.
This is by far the best stout ive ever had.  And its base, Zhukov, is almost as good.

Sweet merciful lord, Ive been looking forward to this for ages. Thanks to a BA for sending me this bottle in what I initially thought was a lopsided trade. Now I feel like things were pretty even in the end. Shared with two fine Dallasites on a muggy Tuesday evening. 

Roughly 6 oz. pour into a tulip/snifter hybrid glass. This beer is darker than the night outside the house. Rich brown head sits just over a centimeter high atop the completely opaque liquid. As I lift the glass to hold it up to the light, hearty legs are already forming where the beer has moved about the glasswares surface. Absolutely beautiful.

Smell is quite strange given the labels description. While vanilla and cinnamon and rich, rich chocolate are all highly evident, our small group also perceived a rather herbal aroma. This likely was caused by the peppers used in the brew, but is still a bit unexpected. Strangely, though, this odd addition doesnt negatively affect the overall aroma. Instead, it adds one more dimension to the already apparent complexity.

First sip is a full assault on my taste buds. Wow. What an incredible rush of flavor. There is so much vanilla, cinnamon, milky chocolate, unsalted caramel, and gentle pepper sweetness that Im momentarily confused. After allowing a few moments to process, I realize this is one of the best beers Ive had the privilege of drinking. The richness is unparalleled.

The texture and feel of this beer is exquisite. Even at 11% ABV, the brewers have achieved a balance between a sweet, sipping beer and a dry, sessionable brew. Theres a viscosity here that Ive rarely, if ever, experienced. After the first taste, I imagined some Exxon Valdez-like tanker had capsized on my tongue, leaving a slick that would maim any seals, pelicans, or mouth-based marine life. I know from the amount of heartburn Im experiencing today that I should never session this, but I am convinced I could take on an entire bottle by myself and have no regrets. 

That was pretty wordy, so Ill sum it up in a sentence fragment: obtain at any cost.

Rating #200!  2012 bottle obtained in a trade.  Pours thick black with a small foamy head.  Nose is rich - chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla, pepper.  Flavor is very complex, with roast, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, and a spicy kick on the back end.  Thick, sticky mouthfeel.  I personally dont care for spicy flavors in beer, but overall this is fantastic.
Amazingly complex aromas - vanilla, hints of pepper, rich tobacco, dark chocolate.  The flavors didnt blow me away - acrid roast, burnt cigar, vanilla.  Well made and interesting.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2013 2013 bottle. Dark beer out of the bottle with a short lived thin brown head.  Molasses nose with some berry sweetness and some chocolate notes.  This beer is so thick it coats the side of the glass when swirled.  Deep rich chocolate flavors of dusty baking chocolate, bitter cocoa, and chocolate covered cherries, with molasses, raspberries, vanilla beans and chocolate cookies.  You can taste the pepper heat and the cinnamon spice.  This beer is sticky on the lips.  This is a very flavorful and complex tasting imperial stout.  Worth seeking out.

Pours thick black with an espresso foam head. The nose is light hops, rich roasty chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla, and light spicy pepper. Taste is rich and decadent with roasted malt, chocolate, booze, cinnamon, vanilla, and a spiciness from the peppers. Mouthfeel and carbonation are perfect. Mouth feel is viscous and smooth with a bit of bitterness in the finish and a lingering burn from the peppers. World class.

2013 vintage into a Teku glass. Thanks so much LiquidDegenerate!

A - Pours a pitch black body with two fingers of dark mocha foam. Settles down quickly and sits still after a few minutes. Moderate lacing with weak retention. Swirling does coat the glass in a thin brownish yellow film.

S - Starts off with roasted char and just a phenomenal chili aroma. It doesnt smell spicy or burnt or over the top, just delicious chili peppers sans the heat. Sweet vanilla, chocolate and earthy cinnamon really work to balance things out on the end. Has a sort of "faux-cinnamon flavored coffee flavored drink" thing going on, but in a good way. Really complex with a lot of different elements working seamlessly together.

T - Very roast dominant, and reminiscent of Founders RIS in the beginning. However things start to get complicated when the vanilla, cinnamon, and chocolate take over. On the very end is some subtle roasted chili flavor and even further back is a slight burn of the tongue. For some reason I was expecting something spicier, not the case as this is beyond approachable. All the flavors are present and just meld together. Medium bodied and creamy. Alcohol is very well hidden.

O - I absolutely love this beer. Completely lived up to the hype for me. The ingredient lists reads off like a most wanted lists for the perfect stout, just fucking fantastic!
2013 bottle. Pours dark with small head. Nose of chillies, cinnamon, and chocolate. Taste is fantastic. Heat, sweetness, booze. Freaking wunderbar! Mouth is solid. Thanks smith1233445553456!

Poured without head but as soon as I put the bottle down it a clay red foam arose from the carbonation. Aroma of chocolate, cinnamon and alcohol. Thick. Spice messes with the palette. Good, but different. I have a hard time finding the vanilla but its there.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 2013 Bottle from Hunahpu Day poured a month later in an official Hunahpu glass. Pours like thick black syrup with a late forming dark brown head. Smells of chocolate, chiles, and more roasty chocolate then some hints of vanilla. Silky chocolate milk up front with a tiny hint of the chiles. Thickest beer i have ever tried. Very little carbonation. Finishes bittersweet, keeping it far from cloying. Chiles help too. But in any case it is dessert on its own.

Got a chance to try the 2014 version from a generous sharer in line at the Swamp Head Bottle Drop.  Thanks!  Pours as before, but this years really has more cinnamon, vanilla, and chile notes than the 2013.  I noted this in the DB Huna as well.  Beautiful aroma and taste of cinnamon filled chocolate, still just only a slight hint of vanilla, and chiles that give this a clean finish and balance the sweet just right.  Freaking awesome.

From the April 2013 3R6P beer tasting. +++ Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily with a medium sized dark brown head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was floral hops, vanilla, cocoa and coconut. The flavor was very strong cocoa powder, rum, anise and toasty malts. Very long finish of cocoa and anise. Thick and creamy body. Excellent.

750 ml bottle from trade with OmegaX.  Thanks Jordan!  Pours pitch black with a dark brown head that fades fast and collects at the edges.  Grabs the glass well when swirled.  Great aroma of cocoa, dark roasted malt, dark chocolate, peppers, and vanilla.  Taste is incredibly rich and well balanced.  Packed with cocoa, chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malt.  Moderately sweet and it seems to fit nicely here.  Awesome peppery and tobacco finish.  Medium body and oily slick mouthfeel.  Great stuff.  I had high expectations for this beer and it delivered.
Chocolate forward with a smoky pepper aftertaste. Highly drinkable even at the high alcohol rate.  This is the 2013 version and I am glad that I was able to get a few for saving.
Black. Dark tan head with red and purple hues. Nose is peppers, cinammon, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is licorice, cacao nibs, spicy peppers, cinnamon. Smooth full mouthfeel.
roasty, toast, herbs, earthy, vanilla, Dark brown, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, sticky, creamy, long finish,

On draft at ChurchKey DC during the Craft Brewers Conference.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted chilis ,  Creamy mouthfleel.  Flavors of roasted malts,  vanilla,  and chili notes.  Smooth and firely finish.

2013 not sure if I got a bad bottle but this thing tasted like it was barrel aged in olives. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 75cl bottle. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: dark beer. Nice thick dark brown head.
Nose: lots of chocolate, coffee, malts, mocha, very sweet.
Taste: vanilla, oily, mocha, milk chocolate, very creamy. Its very sticky to drink and a little to sweet for my taste, but a nice beer
update drank again, 2014 sample. Lots of. Chili pepers noticeable!

Very dark and rich pour with a small head that comes out half as dark as its body. Sweet coffee and chocolate flavors hit you at first followed by subtle vanilla. As the last bit hits the back of your throat you may feel a little tingle from the chili spices. The after taste is much the same as drinking a sweet stout. This beer is different but in a very good way. I highly recommend it to all stout drinkers and for those who dont drink stouts, this might change your mind.
Bottle pour from a trade. Oily black with thick brown head.  Very unique with the pepper, vanilla, and cocoa.  This is definitely a top ten beer for me.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 My favorite beer so far.  This beers pour is dark and thick little head.  If you can get one it is well worth the cost.

Pours a rich deep burnt umber color with a finger of mocha foam. The nose is sweet... traces of bubblegum, roast chocolate, vanilla and a little bit of dark earthy notes. The palate is deadly... damn, rich silky smooth flavors of chocolate cocoa, marshmallow, malt balls... nice peppery spice creeps in mid to late palate and really adds nice complexity without be overbearing. Lingering chocolate and spicy pepper keeps giving.... YUM !

On tap at Hunapuh day. Midnight black. Minimal head. Extremely smooth and chocolatey. The brightness from the peppers up front was a pleasant surprise, and just a tiny amount of heat at the finish. A bit of cinnamon/spice brings it all together.

Bottle from some random guy at a homebrew club meeting.  Quite generous.  Inky black with a lovely looking dark khaki head.  Rich dark aroma of roasted dark deep cocoa and smokiness with sweet raisin and molasses.  Flavor was deep and dark, but yummy sweet, yet also a little overly roasted.  Quite a bit of roast, kinda detracted from the sweet chocolate tones.  Rich and inky, sweet, roasty...Im repeating myself.  Its good, but not $20/bottle insane hype good.

My first time to Hunahpu release. The Beer was amazing. It was one of the best (probably the best) barrel aged beer I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Sybarite Pig bottle share. Pours a jet black, thick, creamy. Light head and little lace. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, olive and alcohol. Taste of creamy dark chocolate, thick malts, caramel, prunes and alcohol. Aftertaste is so pleasant. Cant wait for my next sip.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 Kick butt Imperial Stout! Chocolate, coffee, chili, and vanilla all come through in this one. Very good.

Shared a wonderful  bomber with sherm1016...thanks!!!  Pours a thick black color with thin head....but who cares what this wonderful beer LOOKS like?  initial nose is chocolate with hints of licorice....but is blown away by the taste!   Chocolate; licorice; mild chilli peppers; even hints of (gasp) prunes....and it gets better as it warms....this was a 2010 vintage,,,cant wait for tasting more recent versions.

750ml bottle, received long ago in trade from changeup45, 2010 vintage, split with dwm1034.  Today is Hunahpu Day, so why not.  Pours a thick, jet black color with a thin ring of dark tan bubbles around the edge.  Aroma is roasty, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit, raisin.  Heavy on the palate with light, creamy carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, roasty, black licorice, vanilla, some chocolate, fades into cinnamon, chili, a light spiciness, but not hot.  A perfect chili stout,  I cant answer the aged versus fresh question, but the 2010 is doing just fine three years later.  Excellent.

Black, thick pour. Thin dark brown head. Huge chocolate nose. Big chocolate sweet flavor hints of vanilla. Bit of soy very thick

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2013 Tempting aroma and perfect midnight pour with a crazy complex spicy taste and mouthfeel that constantly changes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

notes from the 2010,2011, and 2012 bottles .. . deep black .. tons of black burnt malts .. . slick full mouthfeel . . just an amazing beer. .. happy to say i didnt get much spice but the fresher bottle had a bit of slight heat .. . a joy to drink .. . . they call my car the beast!

Bottle from OmegaX. Aroma is crazy amounts of malt (roasty and chocolate), chilies, some licorice, kitchen sink, black mold, that black virus from the X-Files, etc. Flavor was the same. I've never seen a darker beer with perfect carb in all my life. Tons of licorice late. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 vintage - Pours as black and thick as any substance on Gods green earth.  Looks like magma flow cooling on the Hawaiian islands.  Virtually no head once the thin tan lacing fades from the pour.  The aroma is filled with sweet chocolate, but a dry pepper note as well.  Something slightly vegetal creeps in at the end, but theres no denying the clear announcement that this is a thick, chewy, stout.  On the palate, youre immediately hit with a lovely sweetness that soon turns to roasty astringency and then to the back-of-your-throat pepper burn.  It really is a cool experience.  Love.

Tap at Capones in 11 and batch#1 bottle compliments of Bill. This review is for the bottle which was close to 3 years old when drank. Pours midnight black with medium coffee head, light lacing. Nose is cocoa cinnamon, ancho chile, smoked wood, hops, tobacco, and vanilla bean. Moderate carbonation. Layered and layered for a stout. One of the best I have tried to date.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 Black as night, invoking brown head from its depths. Even a year later, the chilis are more prominent in the nose of the 2012 than previously. Chocolate malt, vanilla, and cinnamon swirl through my olfactory senses as well.

Massive body delivers this beast to my palate. Layers of complexity summon bold roastyness atop the above flavors, each jumping forward briefly before fading back into the chorus.

Chilis and booze warm my throat as I swallow, leaving a vanilla-chocolate-cinnamon tingle in my mouth long after the beer has departed. An exceptional brew.

Huna is the best yearly special release RIS, QED.

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de café et de chocolat avec une pointe de vanille. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col brun mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat et de café avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de cannelle en arrière goût. (Rating #4583)

2011 Bottle. No head, just a nice lacing around the glass. The scent is of malts, cinnamon, vanilla, and peppers. The flavors blend nicely. The peppers and cinnamon taste good together. The roasted malts and vanilla tame the spice. The after taste is malts and a slight to mild pepper flavor. My palate wasnt hit much. A pepper flavor coated my mouth but it was pleasant and left a warming sensation. Overall this is a very enjoyable drink.

750 ml. 2012 bottle.  Thanks Jason!  Pours an oily black with a reddish brown head.  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, and spices.  Taste is dark malt, chocolate, vanilla, molasses, and spices.  Some alcohol and pepper warmth at the finish.  An experience.

2011 Vintage. S : cinnamon, mollases, boiled vegetables, hints of vanilla, chiles, booze and soy sauce (awful smell). P: black with a very thin lacing. Taste is better then th smell, vanilla and cinammon come through, with roast malt and some chilles in the back. Some heat towards the end. M: syrupy. O: I found this odd, would like to have a fresh one though.

Location: Bottle at Pauls Blind Impy Stout Tasting, 1/5/13


Aroma: The nose is rich and malty, with chocolate, coffee, vanilla, pepper/spices, and booze

Appearance: This one pours into the glass a black color with a brown head

Flavor: The taste is heavy malty as well, not particularly sweet, with roast and spice present

Palate: The body is quite full, with a fairly dense feel, and some heat present as well

Overall Impression: 
I thought this was pretty good, maybe a touch on the heavy side to be super drinkable, but a really nice, well-made beer none-the-less.  Id like to re-visit this one.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 Chilled brown 75 cl bottle poured into a snifter at a JStax tasting.  Pours coal black with very little head.  Very little lacing, thick chewy body, and light vanilla aroma.  Taste is chocolate, cinnamon, and vanilla finish.  Really enjoyed this one.

2012 Vintage. Dark brown to black. No head. Aroma is gritty alcohol. Dull and overly boozy smell. Vanilla bean and chocolate taste. Also get nuts, heath bar, and cinnamon. Very thick beer. Looks a lot like syrup. If I could drink this beer without smelling it, I would enjoy it much more.

Pours a rich dark brown with a reddish dark brown lacing. Aroma consists of notes of chocolate, coffee and licorice. The flavor is sweet and the palate is somewhat acidic. Some chalkiness is apparent, but it doesnt take away from the overall experience.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours black with low dark brown head. Some lacing. Aroma is of caramel, roasted malt, pepper, bread, sugar, molasses. Taste is of spices, caramel, roasted malt, peppers, molasses. Palate: Full bodied. Sticky texture. Overall: Peppery, hot. A good sipper. A bit heavy, and hard to drink.

Bottle (750 ml) 2012. Traded by dsgolovin, thanks David! Pours thick and black with a medium brown head with reddish highlights and some lacing.
