Aroma of vanilla, chile, cocoa, roasted malt and tobacco. Taste is sweet and spicy with vanilla, chile, cocoa and roasted malt. This beer is thick. Extremely well done, original and very complex. Im pleased to had the chance to drink this one, but its not one that I would seek again. Weve split it four ways and we had more the enough (cloying spices and sweetness).

This bottled brew from rbsg #17 poured a small sized head of foamy with a frothy top fine to large sized bubbles that were and left behind a and a good lacing. The aroma was musty hot cigar smoke. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of mild chocolate and dark malt. A wonderful best in class brew.
This stuff is an imperial stout with considerable notoriety. It tastes nice but has a bit of a meaty soy sauce smell. I enjoy the balance of sweetness, heat and spices though. Quite good overall.

This thing is aggressive. Tastes like someone took the deepest, darkest imperial stout and then added cold pressed coffee to it.  Second take: you get the chiles, but only a bit and more in the nose than the flavor.  Tried this at Rebeccas posada courtesy of Pete and Hannah, 2012.

Pours a dark, oily black, with a head that almost appeared to be purple, it was so dark (at first) while setting up. Very pronounced, boozy aroma, with dark fruit, coffee, chocolate, etc. Flavors are very complex, including the chocolate and coffee, there is some plum or raisin in there, too. I didnt taste the peppers at first, but three or four sips in and they get pretty apparent. Thick and oily mouthfeel. Very smooth finish. Worth seeking out to give it a try once in your life.

Bottle from 2011. Pitch black. dark brown head. Malt, dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla in the aroma. Full bodied. malty sweet flavor with dark chocolate, cacao, vanilla. Sharp and roasty on the tongue. Overwhelming imperial stout.
There is no indication of how much it will provide, why should there be? So thick, one could paint with it. The taste is too much for me and that?s just the way I like it.

Bottle shared.  Pours thick black with a small brown head.  Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla, raisins, dark fruits and roasted malts.  Flavour is absolutely full on, moderate to heavy sweet and bitter.  Mouthfeel is extremely thick and oily with a mild chilli heat.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.  An outstanding beer.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. A quite amazing black pour. It looked like crude oil with a thin glass hugging round head. The aroma is spicy  but surprisingly weak. The flavour is ultra rich, bitter and spicy with some medicinal notes on the palate. This won't be to everyone's taste. Some will love it and others won't. For the record, it's a highly unusual ale and I loved it.

66.cl bottle shared. Thanks kermis.
Thin tan head.  Clear black pour.  Lots of chocolate.  Awesome beer .

Nice chocolate roast with a spicy pepper like scent. Has a big hop roast flavor, spicy kick that crawls up and has a decent burn. I would have to be in the mood for spice, or try this with a bit of age on it.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 Viscous midnight black pour. Huge head (and delicous as hi had to slurp it before it foamed over). Sexiest looking brew out there. Smell isnt as good as the rest. It is more cinammon and vanilla cocoa but still good. Flavor starts astringent and bitter, has some dark fruit, not too much sweetness, slight pepper, bitter cocoa up the ass. Vanilla enters as it warms. Thick mouthfeel. My fav stout.

Bottle @ home....vintage 2012 trade form pandableh...It pours jet black with a large creamy long lasting tan head.....The aroma is hard roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice, vanilla and dark fruits.... The flavor is hard roasted malt, coffee, pepper, chocolate and strong licorice.....very nice mouthfeel ... it has a light chili flavor finish.....Thanks Dan....

Poured from a 750ml bottle. Shared while brewing a beer inspired by this one. Very rich and chocolaty, cinnamon, toasty. The peppers have a slight sour note, they are very mild. A nice beer with unraveling complexity. Thanks Jason.

On reconnait la droiture du Général Zukhov derrière ce mélange spectaculaire. La cannelle est bien enrobée de chocolat et de vanille. Les notes pimentés sinstallent au fur et à mesure et deviennent une partie importante de la finale. Ça me rappelle la crème glacée choco mayan, vraiment excellente même si je préfère Zukhov.

2012 bottle poured in a snifter, thanks to Steve. Whenever you get and share a bottle like this, its an experiance treasured. Other reviewers will nail the taste down, but I will note the chilies held up nicely for a 5 month old bottle. Amazing beer that I hope to enjoy again soon.

I shared this guy at the Pre-DLD tasting. 750 ml bottle served, 2012 vintage in a Deschutes tulip. Had this side by side with the 2011 and Bourbon barrel aged versions. Huge thanks to Eric (Holland) for hitting this long time want.

A: Pours a jet black body with dark khaki head forming on the pour. This stuff is viscous. Some splotchy lace is left down the glass.

S: Roasted malts, some sweet chocolate and a nice subtle spice are present in the nose. The nose is a tad boring considering what there is in this beer.

T: The taste is much better. Nice spiciness from the chilies and there is a touch of some cinnamon. Dark chocolate, some figgy fruit notes and some roasted malts round it out.

M: Chewy and thick. The carbonation is on the lower end there is a residual heat from the chilies.

O: A very solid beer. The 2011 vintage definitely lost some of the luster and complexity that the 2012 had. This is a stout that must be drank fresh if you want to retain any of those flavors from the spices and the chilies.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-29-2012

2010 and 2011 Hunahpu's vertical tasting. Both poured black with some head. Chillies and chocolate on the nose. 2010 had a lovely milk chocolate flavor with warming chili notes. 2011 had much more of a dark chocolate flavor with the same chili flavor as the 2010.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a pitch black color with a really dark brown head. The aroma is of vanilla, fudge, chocolate, cocoa, gingerbread, coffee, roasted malt, dark fruits, molasses and lots of nice deserty aromas. Flavors is as amazing as the aroma, it really reminds me of gingerbread, with honey and ginger and cinnamon spice notes, vanilla, dark and sweet chocolate notes, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, fudge, dark fruits and molasses, with a hint of the chili that evolves the more you sip in it. The body is full with a nice sticky and creamy mouth feel. Overall an amazing and different Imperial Stout, I really want to try this BA!

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig, 2012, London. Thanks to Ed - and Paul (if I recall correctly)! Pours deep brown-black with a thick, brown cream head. Aroma holds some lightly tangy dark malts, booze, heavy roast, some spice. Big sweet flavor, lots of dark malts, stinging alcohol, some dark fruits, raisins, tar, burnt wood. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Hot finish with dark baking cocoa, acidic coffee, booze, charred wood. It has a dry, vinous quality to it. Its quite hot. Not overly sweet, which is nice. Very, very good. (4.2)Bottle at The Stouts Tasting, London - thanks to Jack. Pours black-brown with a creamy, brown head. Rich dark malt nose, spices, dark chocolate. Big sweet flavor with oily chocolate, cinnamon and chili, dark char. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Hot finish with more oily, dark chocolate, light chili spice coconut, cinnamon, earthy bitterness, dark malts. Great stuff. (4.3)

A beast - really sweet, but I couldnt stop drinking - not cloying in the least. Sweet vanilla, cinnamon, violet crumble, treacle, coconut, a soft amount of heat from the chilies and a soft roastiness. Really decadent beer with a great weight and balance to it. No real heat to speak of, except the dash of chili. Up there with the best.

Pitch black color.Dark brown head. Dark chocolate, chili powder, cacao, vanilla,  Mouth is slightly hot, spicy, dark cacao, slightly sweet, malty, alcohol very well hidden. Lingering cacao chili finish with moderate amount of alcohol. Very smooth and very well executed. Lovely.

Rich black color; Heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, rich chocolate, coffee, spice, & light chili peppers; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, rich dark chocolate, molasses, rich espresso, hops, vanilla, cinnamon, and hot chili peppers; Finish is bitter; Nicely balanced & complex; The alcohol is fairly well hidden; Overall, quite hot - the peppers really came through; Bold and ridiculously good!

750ml bottle. Pours like dirty motor oil. Brown head. No light coming thru this bad boy. Smells of  everything an imperial stout should and then some. Cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa all come thru individually & combine to create a toasted coconut scent as well. Peppers were not so evident in the nose.  Worth acquiring just to smell this beer. Taste follows suit with the addition of the pepper heat on the tail. Mouthfeel is full and oily slick. Finishes sweet w/ just a touch of heat from the peppers. Wonderful desert impy stout.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Bottle. Pours black with a nice caramel head. Smells of oaked alcohol, chili peppers, dark and milk chocolates, sorghum molasses, wood chips, Whey protein powder, pine needles, and rust. Tastes of dark, dutched chocolate, lactose, slight chili heat, hops, hot cocoa and candied ginger.  Yes.

Acquired this in a trade in February. Enjoyed with friends at cellar temp (60F) in a big red wine glass. 2011 vintage.

A - Poured a viscous thick black appearance. 2 finger totally espresso crema colored head. This head has decent lacing, nice alcohol legs and fades way faster than expected.

S - Bit of a smokey scent. Hints of black peppercorn and vanilla. Some espresso bean characters as well. 

T - A lot spicier than expected but very delicious. Lots of vanilla, burnt / charred oak. Spicy up front and at the end. The middle is sweet, smooth and delicious. Some raisin and cherry characters.

M - Medium carbonation, very heavy body.

O - This was delicious and very drinkable. I expected a lot more spice but this was solid and very drinkable.

Sampled initially at Tryst in Delray Beach, also have a few bottles that will be sampled in the future

From Notes:

A: Absolutely amazing pour. Ominous pitch black oil, huge deep brown head (almost purple), retention is surprisingly good given the ABV

S: Complex to say the least. Chocolate, fudge, vanilla, coffee, lactose, cinnamon, and dark fruit to name the main notes. Overall sweet smelling, but definitely has lots of depth

T: As I suspected, a sweet beer, and alcohol is pretty well hidden. Vanilla, fudge, chocolate, coffee, and cinnamon come the the front. I never really picked up on the peppers, but then again, there is so much going on.

MF/O: Thick and oily feel to it. Smooth and creamy despite the moderate carbonation.

Overall, a stout that should be grouped in with the best, but I never really got that "wow" factor that I was expecting. I still prefer the Abyss and KBS over Hunahpus, but lets see what some cellaring does to this

On tap @ Barcade with James and Streets for the CCB event  09/11/2012. Deep brown color, red tint similar to red wine; rich, husky aroma of smoke, chocolate, wood. Palate is sweet dark chocolate, smoke, maybe some coffee. Mouthfeel is very blunted and keeps me sipping to try to dig out flavors. Liked it more as it went on and the mystery unraveled.

Bottle at Rooie Dop brew dungeon, courtesy of Noize. Very happy to get this one finally. Pitch black colour, medium dark brown head. Nose of roasted malts, lots of chocolate, bit of vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, bit of dark fruits, vanilla, little saltiness. Very tasty.

Quite possibly the best stout I've had.  Just phenomenal with heavy chocolate notes and a beautiful, thick body.  Simply stunning.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 The godfather of imperial stouts, heard about the legend, now drank thanks to stevencon. 2012 bottle, poured thick black with little head or lacing, but great color and viscosity. The aroma was all sorts of great, cocoa, vanilla, cinnamon, roasted malts. Taste is fantastic, but the chilies got lost in this version. That being said, the rest of what I smelled was all there, well balanced, with the alcohol very well hidden. I want a bottle all to myself now. Lived up to most of the hype, just wish the chilies came through more. Have now tried the verticals of 2010 through 2013. The older it gets, the more the chilies die off and give way to a chocolate, almost bourbon barrel aged, sweetness.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2014 Thanks to RasmusOtt for this. First of all: this looks so flippin good. Pitch black beer with a redicolously dark brown head. The head is sooooo thick, creamy and erotic. The aroma doesnt show off, but got lots of chocolate and leather. The taste is massive chocolate and roasted malts followed up with some awesomely delicious spicyness. Vanilla and cinnamon works so well with the chocolate. When the beer arrives in your mouth, you somehow get an erection followed up with multiple orgasms. no shit. Creamy creamy mofo. The creaminess and the gentle chocolate works so well with the spiced part of the beer. I like it.

october 8th, 2014: Have had this beer three times now, and have in this rating not included the green, herbal side this beer has to it, and besides that, it has LOTS of cinnamon. Not just a little! And man!!!! This is so creamy!!!

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 First beer in my new room in Aarhus. Shared with my roomie Niels. Pours good old black with one of the darkest almost redish brown heads Ive ever seen. Stunning! Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa beans, dark dried fruits, cinnamon, sweeter liquorice, rear cigar, vanilla, a note of leather also and some weak spicy/earthy notes. Taste is more roasted and the chili really strikes through in the aftertaste in a pleasant way. Also followed by the cocoa beans, chocolate, liquorice, weak tobacco, alcohol in the back of your throat. It also has that salty quality to it, some espresso notes and dark dried fruits here aswell. Big and full of inspiring nuances! Really diggin the chili in the end featuring the creamyness! 

Re- rate of the Hunah 14. I will not write that much but just enjoy this beer which easily is my fav non barrel aged imperial stout. So smooth so gentle, so much balance and just tropical and exciting. The tickle from the chili is just spot on! Numbers are the same!

Pours black with a finger dark tan head. Still one of the darkest beers Ive ever seen. Smell is a clusterfuck. Got the coco, some spice, some roast and a lot of coffee. Taste is...carrots? Chili and coco, bit of a chalky texture, very well balanced, cinnamon, graham crackers. Magnificent. Loses the red fruit of Marshal but gains so many more flavors. This can stand beside Abyss. Its a near perfect blend of perfect flavors. Rich, but not overpowering. Thick but not heavy. Delicious and beautiful.

Bottle at CCB Day, Sätila 2012-07-07. Black beer with a small brown head. After eight, vanilla, tar, dark chocolate, hoppy, nutty aroma. After eight, spicy, figs, vanilla, tar and dark chocolate flavour. A really nice beer :-)

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 Bottle from trade with StFun. Black pour with a small, medium brown head, and aroma of sweet complex malt and chocolate. Flavor is subtle, of chocolate, cherries, smoke, and a bit of a burn (chilies?). A lot going on, but nicely refined. Carbonation is soft and works well. Sort of velvety mouthfeel. This is pretty complex with interesting flavors, without being overly sweet or over the top. Almost subtle. If I nit pick it, I would want a little more intensity to the flavors.

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig. Cheers to whoever brought along this top want! The pours deep brown with a small tan head. The nose is soured chili, some light red berry fruits. Chocolate and spicy cocoa. Cardamom. The taste is very fragarant chocolate, some mandarin orange spikiness. Strong presence of cinnamon and light chili flake. Nice. The bodys full and thick. Viscous, legs on this. Overall, pretty excellent. Certainly unique, though I probably prefer Zhukov.

2012 bottle. Pours a gorgeous oily black with a very light cirrus-cloud-like head that swirls lovely in the snifter. Aroma of heavy chocolate, some molasses and boozy bourbon, which surprised me since this was not a barrel-aged version. Taste of sweet coffee, biscuit and vanilla, with the flavors complementing each other oh so well. It hides the 11% ABV well; its not nearly as boozy as the nose suggests. Very slick palate. Overall, freaking awesome.

2011 Bottle to glass, multiple 2-4oz pours.  Thick, black pour.  With a swirl, the viscous liquid coats the glass staining it amber for more than a moment.  Aroma is chocolate, toasted wood, and vanilla.  Taste is similar but even bolder plus the subtle addition of chile spice toward the end.  Truly great and I cant wait to try the Apple Brandy version. (from notes)

Bottle at ChrisOs pre-GBBF Shindig provided by Paul Unwin. Oily black, thin tan head. Looks damn good. Nose is sour red fruit, raspberry, dark chocolate, black sugar. Nose isnt winning me over. A lot of sour and bitter red fruit and roasted malt flavours. Taste is awesome though. Pure dark chocolate, fresh black coffee beans or fresh cafetiere coffee, bit of strawberry and raspberry sour fruit. Finish is amazing black coffee and rich pure dark chocolate. Chocolate and coffee bitterness.  Amazing beer and has the richest dark chocolate flavour Ive ever had in a beer. Also some lactic, milky and vanilla notes coming through on the finish.

a-a dark little head on a black as night beer

s- chocolate, coffee, tobacco, hops, charred wood.

t- cocao, pine, dry wood that has been lightly charred, tobacco and coffee and chili warmth at beginning and the end.

md- Silky smooth and very drinkable closer to a medium bodied porter the way it felt. I could drink a bit more and found it to be very drinkable considering its weight.

Bottle @ Fanø Slumber Party, 2012.
Pours deep black with a small, creamy, dark beige film head. Aroma has chocolate, is vinious, sweet, nutty and luscious vanilla. Medium carbonation, fat and creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is fairly sweet, nutty, chocolate, roasted, vinious, pleasantly elegant. At the same time in my face and subdued. Very good despite the sweetness. Warming in the finish.

A pitch black colored beer, with a brown head. The aroma of coffee, dark malts and chocolate. The taste of coffee, fruits, dark malt and chocolate. The aftertaste is a little sweet and bitter chocolate.

Sample at the Pints For Pelotonia charity tasting on 07/21/12: Pours a glossy black color with a medium light brown head that diminishes slowly. Rings of lacing on the glass. Notes of burnt malt, dark chocolate, coffee and hops. Rich and smooth body with a roasty malt and coffee character and notes of chocolate and subtle spice. The finish is spiced coffee and leaves a burnt sugar and malt aftertaste. Excellent Stout overall.

Jeez... This is some filthy shit. Pour pitch black, with a large creamy mocha head, thatll stay there for ages. Jeez boii, this sure is, a beautiful brew. 
Aroma is really powerfull. Chillies, bitter coffee, dark chocolate, oatmeal, smoke, hard roasted malts, vanilla, some roastyness. Faint cinnamon in the way back. Please, some one stop me, I can go on for ages on this one... Big fan. 
Taste is bitter, with a perfect amount of sweetness to it. Sligt heat in the throat, which goes very well with a faint whip from the chilies. Full, fat and oily body, with the right amount of flat carbonation. - Big thanks to Sean for sending me this, more is always wellcome ;) ... Jeez

Beautiful black pour with the most crema-like head you could emagine. Smells initially green or vegetal with clay aromas? and aromatic chili. The licorice is more profound than the chocolate I think. Develops nicely very early and becomes softer and more balanced. The mouthfeel is thick and coating and the fizz is really gentle - which I like. Taste is very complex with a lot going on and yet it is well balanced. Lots of malts and even a slight candied quality. Vanilla makes its entrance on the nose too.. Thick, creamy, elegant and a beast at the same time. Great use of the peppers. Just enough to know its there. Really impressive.  (2012 edition)

Bottle shared at Tkrjukoffs CCB-day in Sätila. Pours black with a medium sized dark brown head. Licorice, vanilla and chocolate in the aroma. Dark chocolat, licorice and coffee in the taste. Some sourness from dark malts.

Had this fresh and a couple vintages. Recommend drink it fresh. The spices and peppers play much better together early on. aged it can take on some green notes that arent bad, per se, but just a shadow of itself comparatively. Fantastic balance of flavors in a rich, oily stout. The additions lighten the mouthfeel for me compared to straight Zhukov=major improvement.

Bottle at CCB Day, Sätila 2012-07-07. Pitch black beer with a nice dark brown head. Mint aroma, chocolate, roasted, milky, cocoa, tar, dark chocolate, vanilla, nutty notes, some hops, soot, figs, raisins, dades. Mint and chocolate flavor, roasted, cocoa, figs, raisins, tar notes, full bodied, with hops balancing. Finish is mint, chocolate, cocoa, figs and milk notes.

Bomber @ CCB Day. Pours oily pitch black with a small rim of brown head leaving some laces. Aroma is fullbodied dar chocolate vanilla sweet vanilla. Flavor is as fullbodied full of fantastic blend of vanilla roasted malts chilies cocoa some sweetness, just so great. Finishes with a longlived hot spicy roasted cocoa and vanilla aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2012 Vertical tasting of the straight Hunahpu - rum, whisky and bourbon barrel aged.
   Hunahpu vintage 2011: pours pitch black with no head. Aromas of liquorice, vanilla, drop/anice and cinnamon on top of intense roaste malt and dark bittersweet choclate. Full full body, leaving a thick cover over the palate, all aromas coming back in the taste, finishing quite spicy and peppery, softly tickling the back throat. A real treat. Certainly worth its money. 4.6/5
   Hunahpu Rum Barrel Aged 2011: much more peppery in the mouthfeel (added with the alcohol warmt of the rum). Nose has more berries and raisins. 3.9/5
   Hunahpu Whisky Barrel Aged 2011: nose has almond and shoe polish, intensity is more subtle than the straigt one and rum one. Actually, I liked this the best when it comes to aroma. 4.5/5
   Hunahpu Bourbon Barrel Aged 2011: (from notes): biggest wauw is the salty finish. 4.1/5

Bottle at Craft Beer Co. Pours motor oil-like, high viscosity. Starts off creamy milk chocolate, then a number of parallel, complex flavors: dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, chili, coconut, roast nuts, spice and cinnamon. Luscious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared at a small tasting by Daknole.  2012 version.  Dark brownish black pour with a nice tannish red head.  Aroma is definitely chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla and some faint chili pepper.  Taste is very similar with some roastiness to go along with it, and maybe a little bittersweet and the chills come out a little more after pairing with some dark chocolate.  This is very awesome.

The last three times I have had this beer, I have been blown away. If I could have but one stout in my cellar, this is the one.

The beer appears black as night. The void. Quite possibly the darkest beer I have ever seen. The head is beige and thick, coating the glass in lacing.

The aroma brings a potent dose of roasted malt, alcohol, chiles, cocoa, vanilla. Wow, this beer smells fantastic.

Unbelievably well-balanced and teeming with flavor. Simply amazing. The chiles have a big presence in the beer, but dont put out an overabundance of heat or spice. Masterfully done there. Cinnamon, vanilla, and oak meld beautifully with a full-bodied, roasty stout.

Perfect carbonation level. Every sip leaves a thick coating of rich stout on the palate. The feel is just perfect.

Overall, one of the best beers, and certainly among the finest imperial stouts I have ever had. My highest recommendation.

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours an amazing black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, smoked chilli, cinnamon. Flavour of the above, chill, burnt caramel, with a burnt/peat/iodine finish. Full bodied, dry finish. Nice.

Rating #2500. 750mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany). Pours pitch black with a small brown head - looks beautiful. Nose of mild chili peppers, which dont overpower, cocoa nibs, vanilla, hint of cinnamon - the chilis are slightly more prominent in the nose than in the flavour... Flavour is dominated by rich chocolate cake, with vanilla beans, burnt caramel, and subtle chili peppers - the chilis start off more prominent, but then fade into the background. With each additional sip, the chilis becomes less and less noticeable, paving way for intense chocolate cake qualities. Rich layers and full-bodied. Very well-made and enjoyable.
Bottle to oversized snifter (thanks mikem409). Looks good; pitch black with nice lacing. Smells good too; malty and roasty. Tastes solid; spicy with a dry finish. Very nice!
Intense taste of chocolate, syrup, roasted malts and a nice spicyness in the aftertaste.

Pitch black with a dense dark brown head. Massive aroma with so much going on its almost over the top. Same goes for the flavor, intense chocolate, spice and a fat malty roastiness accompanied by an equally fat body. Tasty..

Pours a 1 finger thick beautiful mocha head dissipates to form a solid ring around my ccb snifter and stays throughout the drink. It has an aroma of strong dark chocolate with coffee in the background. It tastes of chocolate up front, coffee and vanilla notes with a finishing burn from the alcohol then from the peppers. This beer is so complex I am tasting something different each time I try it. Hunahpus is the greatest beer Ive ever had, so complex and so delicious!

draft, pours black with frothy tan head. nose is molasses and slight coffee with roasted flavors. first sip is nice with toasted flavors and roasted malt with coffee and burnt sugar. finish is plesant with coffee bitternes.

Bottle thanks to thome50. 2011 edition. Pours pitch black with an oily, very dark brown chocolate head. It quickly disappears to nothing. Nose is heavy on milk chocolate, spices, light salt, light chilli and a mingling sweetness to gel it all together. Works well. Taste is sweet while at the same time robust and smokey. Cigar box notes come out to play while it finishes very spicey and chocolatey. Chilli is right on the back end. The palate is very full and creamy. Very lengthy. Leaves a nice bite to finish. Great beer

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 Shared by someone at the Montes Krown tasting yesterday.  Pours a jet black with a brown head that reduces to a lace quite quickly.  Smell is cocoa, spice, dust.  Taste is sweet, spicy. Finish is spicy with some sweetness.

From notes at (StoutFest). Bottle via mattyb83 and sorta thanks to ericandersnavy who originally sent me the bottle that was stolen by some meth heads living next to my grandma. Aroma is cinnamon, chocolate, sweet. Taste, slight coffee with a load of cinnamon, dark chocolate and some faint chili heat. Overall, nice, but nothing amazing. The chili is nice with the style but I love the heat.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Truly exciting and unique, The  texture and subtleties of this beer are superb, it really is fantastic.

Loved this beer since first taste. Pours a pitch black with a rich red head. Aroma is mild spice with roasted malts, vanilla notes. Flavor explodes with vanilla, cinnamon and mild spice, obviously, but its milky, creamy, mild bitterness with light sweetness following from the vanilla. Flavor lingers for a decent minute, and Im okay with it. Awesome flavors all day long

Bottle.  Pours a near black color with a thin dark tan head.  Aroma of dark roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, tobacco, and a hint of chili pepper.  Flavor is just awesome with the chocolate and especially the chili really come through as it warms.  Visually very enticing as well as the beer leaves a viscous tan sheen skinny the side of the glass as you swirl it around.  Glad I finally got to try this local treasure.  It did not disappoint!

A: Poured a sluggish near pitch black with a huge brown cap, loads of lacing, amazing!

S: Big fresh cocoa, like hot chocolate, some spice, heat, wood, coffee and wow it smells so good

T: A rich cocoa presence here, dark and light chocolate, roasted malt, booze, cinnamon and light spice from the peppers. Big sweetness with some roasted marshmellows and vanilla. Extremely decadent and flavorful. Among the best of not the best Imperial Stout I have ever had. 

M: Where do I begin? Big, rich and sweet. Big body, well carbonated, loads of taste!

O: WOW!

2011 Bottle.  Pours oil black with dark tan head that holds up pretty well. Smell is roasted dark malts, bitter chocolates,  tobacco, and spice.  Taste is chocolate, coffee still reasonably strong, and the chili hides in the back but is certainly there.  Other notes of vanilla and tobacco.   Not sure if there are still hops hanging around, the chilis or the bitter chocolate, but there is certainly a hanging bitterness. While this was good and the chilis certainly put it in a category of different, very good.

Bottle at Kickbacks... Pours jet black with a slight tan head. Strong Smell of coffee, molasses and roasted malt. Initial tastes of coffee followed by chocolate with hints of vanilla and chili. Amazing beer!!
Bottle, pours a nice dark black, with a tan head. Aroma is full of coco and lots of coffee and espresso quailities, nice smoothness and a really easy drinking beer. This one is enjoyable

Bottle @ home. Aroma is roasty malt, chocolate, molasses, coffee, spices, this, that and more.
Flavour is deep and roasty, with molasses, chocolate, huge espresso, quite bitter and roasty, yet creamy. Lazy rate, awesome beer.

I brought this one to stakems fish fry. One of my personal favorites, this particular bottle was from the original release.

A - Pours jet black with a nice one finger tall tan head leaving small, thin trails of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of chocolate, chill spice, dark roasted malt, coffee grounds, tobacco and a tiny bit of vanilla. This one has muted quite a bit from when it came out.

T - Starts off with a ton of dark roast quickly giving way to a mix of dulled chocolaty sweetness, day old coffee grounds, light chili spice and some wet tobacco. Not as muted down as the nose is, still very nice. A touch of booze comes in at the finish, combining with some of the dark roast to linger on the pallet for some time.

M - This is definitely a big beer. It has lost some of its trademark spice over the years in the bottle but it still has a nice thick body and bold flavors with a good amount of carbonation.

O - This one was definitely showing its age. When fresh, this beer is nearly impossible to beat. I will never turn down a glass of this beer. It is truly one of the best stouts out there.

Black bodied with firm tan head. Looks great. Creamy, lots of flavour vanilla, chocolate, spices bread. Very smooth body warming backup. Faint hotness, but nothing burning. Does make a very rich taste. Sticky body. Very flavourful. (75cl bottle, at dEnk house tasting)

Bottle at mini-dEnk tasting. Pitch black pour, solid creamy deep dark tan head. Aroma of super smooth roasted goodness. Super slick, ultra smooth, huge bodied and immense well balanced great brew. Lovely.
It poured a pitch black color with a small off-white head. The aroma was malt, coffee and green peppers. The flavor followed the nose. This was a really good beer.

Bottle. Opaque, black liquid with mahogany/red hue and really tan/brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, chili (ancho), fresh coffee, licorice, wood and some ash and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with notes of chocolate/cocoa, fresh coffee, deep chili flavours and vanilla. Absolutely delicious. Full bodied with nice carbonation and really creamy, sticky mouthfeel. Super balanced and well made. Lots of chocolate/cocoa, vanilla and some deep chili.

Pours pitch black with a Frothy dark Brown head. The nose is dark fruits, roasted malt, cocoa, molasses and coffee. The taste is molasses, burnt malt, dark chocolate, coffee and a nice bitter hoppy finish. This beer has several different layers of complexity as it warms. Including The pepper warmth.  Medium creamy mouth feel. Very good  worthy of the hype.

Bottle 75cl, aroma chocolate, coffee, vanilia, cinamon what a great smell. 
Black like oil, stick head red/hazelnuts. Medium sweet, light bitter good taste never have before. Full Body, oily sticky. For me the best IS of the world i ever tasted!!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Date: March 24, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: DalzAle tasting Description: Opaque black pour with nice brown head and lacing.  This was smooth, chewy, chocolate and fudge.  Like a liquefied fudge brownie, just delicious.  Thanks Caleb for sharing!

Re-rate on November 16, 2012 bottle shared by Brandon.  This had way more spice than I remember.  Moved down taste, palate and overall by one each.

Bottle shared by CLevar - thanks Caleb! Super thick, tan head, deep dark black. Smell is a touch sweet, toffee, chocolate. Coats your mouth in rich, chocolate goodness! Fantastic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an opaque sable with a thick, fine-bubbled cinnamony tan head. Strong, smoky, chocolaty aroma has hints of cinnamon and vanilla. Mouth-filling roast coffee flavor has tones of caramel and chocolate plus hints of hot pepper and licorice. Firm, almost syrupy, smooth texture is quite fizzy.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 750 ml bottle courtesy of and shared with Marsiblursi. Many thanks! 2010 vintage. Pours oily black with a small dark chocolate brown head that quickly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is sweet with roasted malts, wood, tobacco, vanilla, milk chocolate, prunes, cinnamon, brown sugar, alcohol, soy and hints of smoke, flower nectar and red chili. Taste is sweet, bitter and salty with heavily roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, very ripe grapes, cinnamon, chocolate, dark bread, golden syrup and hints of liquorice fudge, soy, smoke and chili powder. Mouthfeel is oily, very silky, tiny sticky sweet and full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and tiny tart with heavily roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate, wood, cinnamon and smoke. Quite nice and with incredibly clear notes of the stuff theyve put in it.Re-rate @ tkrjukoffs CCB Day July 7 2012. Intense dark chocolate and cinnamon smell. Intense dark chocolate taste. Amazing! Much better than the last vintage I tried.

Pour a dark, thick black like used motor oil. It has a slight orange tinge to the head (what little there is).  Strong aroma of dark cocoa, ancho, and espresso. It kinda has a consistency of chocolate liqueur.  Great flavors: more espresso and dark cocoa followed by more chocolate liquer and a faint spicy aftertaste on the palate. Overall, Im quite impressed!  Thanks to ericandersnavy for the hookup!

22/III/2012 75cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Klaas place - BB: n/a (2012-260) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle! 
Dark brown to black beer, no head. Aroma: lots of chocolate, dark caramel, bourbon, vanilla, red wine, bit dusty, coffee. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: chocolate, raisins,  mocha, caramel, sweet syrup, alcohol, bit of chili pepper. Aftertaste: coffee, some bourbon, vanilla, bit of hops, ashes. Damn, good stuff!

750ml bottle via trade with omegax - HUGE thanks, Jordan!
Pitch black brew with tons of tan head.  Big time roasted and chocolate aromas with some earthy chiles, vanilla, and spices.  Lots of cinnamon up front balanced by flavors of fudge and vanilla with a near perfect amount of heat from the chilis on the back end.  I love it when beers live up to their hype!

Bought a case at Hunahpu Day.. Love that chili/chocolate combo. Comparing this to the Dark Lord, I would give it the leg up(unless you are aging). Dark lord was too syrupy and sweet and almost too overpowering with vanilla. Both are great stouts, but for my tongue, Hunahpu wins.

Pours thick and black with an equally thick tan head that lasts a good minute before receding to a colar that leaves some killer lacing.
The aroma is great, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, and cinnamon.
I taste coffee, choclate, cinnamon, vanilla, with heat from the chillies sneaking in at the end.
Big syrupy mouth feel, very full body, low carbonation.
Yum!

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 This is a an impressive specimen. Pours a thick black sludge; looks like Cuban coffee with a beautiful tan head that lingers slightly. The aromas hit you with a blissful reminder of how excellent an imperial stout can be. Right off the bat you get chocolate, cinnamon, brown sugar and coffee.  The taste is a flowing river of constantly evolving notes. Vanilla , a little bit of heat , cinnamon , chocolate, toffee, and sticky syrupy molasses. This is a full bodied expedition which will force you to evaluate and rethink your purpose in life. This is verbose and I will not apologize. Tried this again last night and yeah this is the best imperial stout Ive had, better than dark lord.

(trade w/mcGrupp612)  750ml btl - Pours a VERY dark tight foam head. Lasted about two minutes in the glass before falling. Body is pretty much black as sin. Aromas of toffe and chocolate. Some  smoke aroma from the ancho. Mouthfeel like motor oil. Flavor is stunning!! Lots of molases and dark brown sugars. Dark fruits. Smoke from the peppers blends well with  he other ingredients. Shows up on pallete  IF you know what youre looking for. If I smoked I could see sitting back with a big maduro, waxing about the  news of the day, sitting on the plantaion veranda!!

Sampled at Trail Magic release party. Pours brownish black with quick tan head. The aroma is raisin and molasses, walnut, and vanilla. The flavor is lots of vanilla and raisin. Quite sweet altogether. The finish is nutty with some interesting spice notes and a lingering sweet aftertaste. I dont pick up the peppers really, but get vanilla more than anything.

Had 2012 brew on tap at Hunahpu day. Was absolutely fantastic. this is easily one of the top three beers I have ever had. The aroma of this beer is amazing (vanilla, cinnamon, choc, etc.). I was surprised at how smooth this beer goes down for such a heavy stout. I am not a big stout drinker ( more of a hophead) but this beer is definitely worth the hype. Even if you are not a fan of stouts, you should give this brew a try if you ever get the chance because this beer is too good to pass up.

Its kind of ridiculous it took me this long to rate this beer.  2012 Hunahpu on tap at Hunahpu Day.  Black with a creamy frothy brown head on top.  I dont really pick up a ton of  chili pepper in the scent.  Lots of mocha, dark chocolate, and light vanilla, however, with some ash as well.  The flavor is completely different.  Tons of cinnamon and chili pepper heat mixes with smooth mocha, sweet vanilla bean, and some caramel notes.  Finishes somewhat dry with ashy bitterness.  Big beer.  Very very interesting stuff and quite good.  Incredibly silky smooth considering the sharp flavors.  Its amazing how the ingredients all come together when I didnt get all that complexity in the aroma.

jet black, dark tan head. aroma is spicy, lots of chillies and peppers, toffee, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, taste starts spicy, cinnamon, prunes, toffee, chocolate, coffee, great thick texture, outstanding beer

Hell, its about time. Draft at CCB. 2012 batch. Nose is loads of cinnamon and chocolate. A hint of vanilla and roast round this one out to make it quite pleasing. I like how you can easily identify each element of flavor/aroma to this beer. Pour is jet black with that dark khaki head. Stains the glass...almost permanently haha. Taste wise this one is loaded with more cinnamon and vanilla flavors. Earthiness probably from the chiles.  Lots of nice chocolate and roast. Good stuff and very well rounded. One of the beers that deserves hype.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2013 2013 bottle from Hunahpu Day
Appearance - Oily black body, dark brown head
Aroma - Coffee, vanilla, pepper, cinnamon, molasses chocolate
Taste - Dark chocolate, coffee, earthiness, vanilla, cherries

Ive had every years version except the first one, and this time they really nailed it. So much chocolate and pepper with a soothing vanilla presence, all brought down to a clean coffee finish with a touch of cinnamon. So much going on here, and it seems to change as it ages quite dramatically.

Bottle. Thanks Noize. The aroma has chocolate, some vanilla, fruitiness, roast, hint of spice. Black coloured beer with just a small beige head. The taste is bit bitter, bit sweet, has chocolate, roast, berrie-like fruitiness, vanilla, some coffee. Medium-full bodied imperial stout. Quite complex, full of taste sensations. Nice one.

2011 Bottle; Pour is the most ridiculous thing Ive witnessed thus far; motor oil consistency, with a very dark amber / khaki head in this glass. Retention is average, with some light lacing as well. The nose is astringent, cinnamon, cocoa............ the flavor profile reveals more, however. I feel like the appearance was the highlight on this brew; regardless. the flavor profile reveals the chiles... i was expecting more out of them, honestly. Cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa, chocolate, dark fruits, and more chocolate honestly. Very impressive brew, worthy of its place on the list. There is a hint of metallic, its sweet, some bitter roast as well. Nice... obviously.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 From notes.  First reviewed 1/31/2011.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a pint glass.

This pours out jet black viscous liquid.  There is almost no head to speak of.

Dark chocolate, vanilla, espresso, a dark blend of smoothly roasted malts, and chocolate malt are all present.

I really enjoyed trying this in the same sitting as the Marshal Zhukovs. The flavors in each beer are so smooth and complex, it is no wonder that Cigar City has a great reputation. Dark chocolate blends with dark roasted malt and a bit of espresso to start the sip. More chocolate continuously comes through as the sip progresses, with a darker and more bitter roasted malt to accompany it. A touch of chile and heat come through right at the end. The aftertaste is somewhat bitter and chocolaty.

Absolutely velvety smooth, with great depth of flavor. The body is extremely full, with lots of creamy carbonation. Lightly sticky sweet, but not overly so. 

This is pretty awesome, it definitely lived up to my expectations. Since we were drinking the 2010, the flavors and aromas had really blended together nicely. This created a very smooth transition between the different aspects of the flavor, but it also made some of them difficult to isolate or taste. I only got a very mild heat from the chiles, and I could not get any hint of cinnamon. Definitely looking forward to this years release.
A fantastic stout. Heavy and super dark. Aroma and flavor are top notch. I highly recommend trying this is you enjoy dark stouts
Pours a dark brown with a diminishing head. Dry and fruity. Aromas of dried dates and prunes. Hints of metals and chalk. Also hints of tobacco. Full bodied

2011 bottle pours a dark black color that stains the glass, aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, cinnamon, pepper, spices, and a touch of vanilla.  Flavor is the same as the nose, there the chocolate balances out the spice.  Glad I have a few more bottles of these.

2011 bottle at home. It pours jet black, with a thin dark tan head, which quickly dissipates. The nose is soy sauce, chocolate, a hint of chilli pepper, paprika, roasted malt, coffee, toffee and meat. The taste is chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, salted caramel, soy sauce, toffee, tanginess, tar and burnt tire, with a dry-roasted finish. Full body, low/fine carbonation and dense, sticky mouth-feel. Not quite as sweet as expected. Alcohol is pretty well hidden, but the dense nature makes it pretty tough going. It is good, but for me anyway doesnt belong anywhere near the top 50!

Pours pitch black with a medium dark mocha head...beautiful color and decent lacing.  Aroma is milky with mild dark fruit and slightly sweet dark chocolate...very faint vanilla and cinnamon.  Flavor is very chocolatey!...hint of dark fruit and vanilla...very faint cinnamon and pepper.  Mouthfeel is full and creamy with a sweet cocoa finish that has a nice subtle burn from the chiles.
Had this from a bottle, sweet smell,  wonderful dark color, and great sweet taste.

If there were such a thing as heaven, it would be located in this bomber.  I know where Im getting more next year.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What a ridiculously delicious beer.  Aroma is dark chocolate, dark fruits, coffee.  The palate is thick creamy and just the right amount of carbonation.  The taste of this beer is nothing short of spectacular.  Reminds me of toasted coconut dipped in chocolate.  Notes of cinnamon and very light chilis with a nice dose of chocolate. vanilla, and coffee.  First class beer.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 This beer is ridiculous, tons of coconut, roastedalts, vanilla, chillies. Absolutely love it, thanks collin!!!

Reviewed way back in 2009 from a bottle that was hand bottled from a growler.  This was before the beer was released in bottles.   I popped the cap off and was greeted by a nice pffft.  I was worried that when I opened this beer that to much air would of gotten to it and ruined the experience.  No sir it was perfect.  The beer poured thick and black.  A huge creamy tan head poured.   This beer poured perfect.  The smell on this beer is fantastic.  Deep chocolate malt, vanilla, smokiness, and spice.  Yup spice.  A nice amount of cinnamon and chili pepper.  It hits the nostrils but doesnt overwhelm.  Not to much of a burn.  Definitely a unique aroma that you dont usually get from a stout.

The taste on this beer is just amazing.  So much going on.  Really complex.  The taste happens in waves.  Up front is the chocolate and vanilla.  Its sweet and slightly bitter.  Next up is the smokiness and roasted malt.  Then the spices hit.  They just sit on your tongue.  When I first sipped this brew the spices werent to noticeable.  But as you take sip after sip the hotness starts to sit there.  Not overwhelming though like some other beers Ive had.  Finally there is a bit of a bitter ending from the hops.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 Bottle @ home, courtesy of thebeersommelier. Thanks! 2010 bottle. Initially has a one finger, dark brown head but that quickly dissipates and also has a pitch black appearance. Rich anise, cocoa, mild vanilla, thick chocolate malty aroma. Thick, somewhat syrupy mouth feel. Initially, theres a very rich cocoa, mild vanilla, woody, dark chocolate malty flavor that then has more of the creaminess and peppers on the finish. Theres a thick coating on my tongue after drinking this. Rich cocoa, light anise, mild vanilla aftertaste. This sucker is thicker is thicker than almost any other beer Ive ever had. Not sure if the peppers faded or if theyre naturally not too pervasive, but they are a nice addition to the finish. Tasty beer for sure. (4.1)Update: Awesome (4.6)

750 mL bottle shared at the January 2012 Santa Cruz tasting at Sante  Adairius. Not sure of the year but this is from the first bottling of the beer.  Deep black pour with that signature Cigar City imperial stout head. Just a  ridiculous shade of neon brown. Boozy roasty aroma, robust chocolate,  fresh coffee, light iodine. Massive dark chocolate flavor, light smokiness, cocoa, and a mild vanilla bean note. The chilies are pretty subdued at this point but they still impart a bit of flavor without any heat. Viscous heavy bitter mouthfeel, not boozy. Nice glass-staining legs. Killer beer.
Literally my favorite drink, the aroma, head, taste aftertaste, everything is just magnificent

2011 bottle opened Dec 29 for the birth if my first nephew. The aging time was perfect (10 months) poured into a CCB snifter, jet black with a milk chocolate head, the nose gave off the vanilla, coffee, and cinnamon. The flavors set off the same with some smoke and then of course the chili lends a slight tingle at the end. This beer is extremely complex yet balanced as well.

Bottled, thanks baggio!  Very black, small brown head. Heavy on cocoa and coconut. Sweet with clean mouthfeel and less full body than anticipated. Flavours of milk chocolate, vanilla and treacle. A slight chili tingle in the finish. The aggressive Marshal Zhukov istamed by the added spices, but the hard mouthfeel is still there.

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Crazy looking pour! Black, viscous, with an ultra thick, creamy head. Chocolate, peppers, vanilla in the aroma. Lots going on in this beer, but it still manages to be so balanced and mellow. Medium to heavy sweet, full mouthfeel. Taste of chocolate and coffee, fresh peppers, vanilla, cinnamon in the background. Im impressed. Good stuff.

Several draft samples at GABF 2011. Nose of chocolate, vanilla, light smoke, and peppers. Black with a small cinnamon tan head. Flavor is chocolate, light smoke, nice pepperiness, cinnamon, and vanilla.

750 ml - Thanks for sharing this gem, ygtbsm94.  Brad--you are the man (as you might have not already known).   Pitch black, thick dark tan head.  Monster spicy chocolate cinnamon and peppery vanilla espresso aromas throughout.  Flavor is similar and very well balanced. Syrupy, full bodied, and absolutely stunning and unique throughout.  Cheers to the CCB boys.  Keep up the great work...
bottle thanks to meadme. this is probably the best beer i have had to date. so much going on the flavors change as the beer warms the cinnimon and vanilla were just right
Amazing pour. Pitch black with a dark brown reddish tint. The chilis are amazingly subtle and the cocoa and vanilla is insane. Thanks daknole!

750ml bottle thanks to mikesgroove. 2011 batch I believe.
Appearance :Pitch black with small dark brown head.

Aroma : Big chocolate with hot peppers. Nice vanilla too. Very rich.

Taste : Hot peppers with chocolate, some coffee. Lots of hops. Finish is long, persistent and rather sweet. Lots of chocolate and coffee. Lots of hops also. Rather bitter also.

Overall : This is one big beer. Very sweet and very rich. Bitterness helps balancing out some of the sweetness but its still pretty sweet. We were only two on this and I had a hard time finishing it. Very nice mix of chocolate and hot peppers both on nose and taste. Only reason why Im not rating this higher is because its a bit too sweet and it gets very cloying. Ill always be very happy to snap a few ounces at tastings but Im never going to open a bottle with only 2-3 people. I also dont think its up there with my favorites RIS (Speedway, Darkness, Abyss, etc)

Been a long time coming to get one of these.  Courtesy of Shaftie.  Viscous Zhukov like pour with the darkest brown head I have seen yet.  Just crazy gorgeous.  Aroma was out of this world.  Tons of cocoa and roasted malt, rather big vanilla sweetness and just a hint of spice.  Not much from the chilies.  Really in a league of its own at this point.  Flavors were also full of rich dark cocoa, lightly sweet, some vanilla and a hint of cinnamon and spice.  Oh how this warmed up so nicely.  A new top for me and worthy of all its praise.  The cinnamon and small hint of chilis really gave this one a wow factor.  Quite incredible.

Bottle shared at the big Hair of the Dog PreSale Tasting...  Poured jet black with an off-white head.  Thick palate, full bodied, really coated the tongue.  Nicely spiced, and quite balanced given all of the spices.  Some malted sweetness and roast, honey, simple syrup, and an alcohol heat that crept in.  Which Im sure the peppers accentuated.

Epic tasting at Chriss place with Dak in attendance.  Knocked off 3-4 top 50 beers in one night.  A bottle of this was passed around, and a bottle of the BA was passed around.  An interesting discussion ensued.  I actually preferred the smooth warmth of the BA, while others preferred the subtle nuances of pepper and cinnamin that were obscured by the strength of the BA treatment.  This was rich and sharp.  Definitely pick up the spiciness.  Id love to have a 10 oz. pour of this to spend an hour with as it warmed up.  Nice brew.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2013 2011 Bottle at Fermentation Lounge. Pours pitch black with a creamy dark brown head with hints of ruby. Aroma is tons of unsweetened chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malts and vanilla. Sweet cocoa up front and roasted coffee beans fading in chocolate with chilis and cinnamon coming in at the end. Very rich body but not overly sweet and alcohol is well hidden. Extremely good beer.

slightly thick black opaque pour rich tan head medium size coffee aroma liquorice smooth vanilla influence cinnamon dark chocolate cacao freshness dark fruits soft carbonation the cacao flavour through the ale with a coconut taste it is smooth on the palate a peppery taste bright  and balanced dark fruit and chocolate medium bitter strong bodied and filling supreme tastes to the finish with peppery aftertastes velvety smoothness cacao and vanilla mix dark malts and fruit lasting bitter superb imperial by CC bright and delicious,Thanks to DT in themidwest for the ale.
Chocolatey aroma.  Black in color with a deep tan head.  Chocolatey, raisiny with a slight spiced complexity (almost cinamony).

750ml thanks to jrob21. Pours black as night with a thick skim of soapy, mocha brown head that has great retention and leaves a few specks of lacing. Aroma is roast, sweet malt, earth, autumn leaves, spice, chocolate, dark caramel and light ashy smoke. Flavor is roast, coffee, lots of chocolate, heavy toasted nuts, light smoke, spicy cinnamon, roasted peppers, earth, toast and vanilla. Finishes with toast,roasted nuts, molasses, vanilla and herbal hops. Palate is heavy bodied, creamy and a little sticky throughout with a light carbonation and fairly neutral finish. Fantastic beer, really just works deliciously from the first sip at nearly fridge tamp to the last at nearly room temp.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 75cl, Vintage 2014, no mention of ABV, exclusive American brew, with cinnamon and chili peppers, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex sweet Stout, sweet/roasted and slightly spicy, very balanced, hazy, good head, top class!, yet very expensive!

750 ml brown bottle. 2011. Pours a thick bad ass used motor oil black with a head that is also black and some tan. ive never seen a head so black on a beer. The aroma has chocolate, spices, vanilla, and some pepper spice. Wow the taste is like a chocolate milkshake and the more I smell it I realize there is a lot of bready qualities, very bready. The taste also has roasted, spices, chocolate. This is a massive beer and all its parts seem to work together very well. the palate is rich and creamy. This really reminds me of the Frrrozen Hot Chocolate at Serendipity 3 if anyone has been there. Possibly the baddest flavorful Imperial stout with out being over the top.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Pours black with dark brown head.  Smells of chocolate and a bit of coffee.  Tastes of chocolate, caramel, its nice and roasty and leaves a beautiful heat lingering on the palate.  Alcohol content smooths out this beer nicely.  Considered using it as cologne, but decided that anything other than drinking it would be a disgrace.

2011 vintage. Very dark pour. Taste is of rich chocolate with a hint of chili pepper. One of the thickest beers bodywise I have ever had. Alcohol is hidden extremely well. Great beer, havent had any others quite like it.

BLACK with dark brown head. Chocolate, gamey-meat, vanilla, thick meat sauce. Flavor is peppered and spiced all chocolate burnt up with caramel. Reminds me of a dark chocolate caramel out of a really nice box of chocolate with peppered meat added.
Pitch black body with a small white head. This entire beer resonates class, strength, complexity. As such, detailed descriptions beyond the notion that this is quitessential imperial stout, are moot.
Only issue was the chiles had already faded. The 2010 version I had in LA were still there. Big, massive and oily. Lots of chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon and marshmallow.  impressive beer.
Pours dark brown with complex notes of vanilla and cocoa.  The thick mouthfeel breeds notes of vanilla, sweet caramel, and some bright heat from the peppers.  A nice long finish with continued heat.

Bottle with thanks to fletchfighters. Pours jet black with great dark tan coloured head. Very oily in the glass leaving staining where ever it touches. Great looking beer. Very robust complex nose shows plenty of bitter chocolate, licorice, vanilla, tobacco and some roasted grain. Great stuff. Flavours are just as expected. Not overly sweet. Bitterness starts to come through near the finish and does some heat from the lacohol. Velvet mouthfeel. Very full. Amazing beer.

Have had this fresh and aged.
Drink it fresh the peppers are a bit more noticable obviously, and add that extra something to make this one stand out. With age it turns into a more typical yet still outstanding stout that has alot of viscosity and some good chocolate and caramel flavors.

2010 bottle curtesy of Matt, shared with Steve to celebrate a new job starting tomorrow. Viscous, opaque black with a dark brown head. Anice, dark chocolate, huge roasted malts, some booze, hints of vanilla and chilli. Full bodied yet smooth and somewhat creamy, starts slightly bitter, well carbonated, becomes a little more bitter with some sweetness from the vanilla balancing things out. A very good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2015 Black beer, like oil. Good very dark brown head, holds decent but should be a bit bigger. Roasted, liqourish, good spiced, good hopped. Chocolate, coffee, the alcohol is there also for sure, but not overwhelming. Bitter, nice good holding chocolate aftertaste. This is good for sure, but ofcourse this style is my thing... Edit: Also after retasting, i cant say this got to many points for sure. Love it.

Pour from a large bottle thanks to my good friend Kan. Dark black in color with a small thin tan head. Aromas o peppers and cocoa. Full silky rich body in your mouth. Delicious complex and balanced flavors of coffee, vanilla, molasses,and  spicy pepper undertones add to the mix.Long finish that is fantastic. One of my new favorite beers for sure.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Jet black in colour with moderate carbonation and an odd coloured (beige with a hint of red) head. Aromas are of roasted malt, spicy pepper, raw chocolate, vanilla, and Mexican coffee. Sort of like a fancy spicy peppery hot chocolate in the mouth, along with more vanilla, red bean, and medium roast coffee. Heavy bodied, with the peppery heat providing some interesting balance on the palate. Amazing stuff.

Bottle thanks to Dstructo! Pours is super dark, thick with s small brown head.  Roasted malts, raisin, chocolate and faint coffee on the nose.  The taste is amazing.  First I get the traditional imperial stout flavors (dark and crystal malts) followed by an amazing sweet chocolate flavor.  Almost fudge like!  Vanilla comes in lightly and finishes with the pepper heat.  I didnt really get the cinnamon.  Awesome mouthfeel.  So thick and creamy.  Many beers today do not live up to the hype, however this one far exceeded my expectations.  Excellent beer.  I cant wait for it to come out again so I can try it very fresh to get more heat from the peppers!

RBSG 2010 on the bus to Ypsilanti. Lame notes from notepad on my ipone. I saw the bottle! Black! Smells warm and wonderful. Mounds of this stuff: rich chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, ancho peppers (I was told this is what I smell), earthy, licorice, light vanilla - simply amazing. Taste: Heat!, chocolate, earth, candy, has some hot chocolate, light smoke, licorice, cinnamon. Smooth mouth feel with a wonderful light heat lingering. Excellent excellent beer.

Pours clear (?) black with a small dark brown head. Complex but well-balanced aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, "drop" and alcohol. In the taste again roasted malts (coffee, choclate), salted liqourice (umami), some spices and alcohol. Low carbo, great body. Superb! Thank you drowland.
C: Opague black. S: Coffee, roasty, malty. T: Hoppy and roasty. P: Full body.

Thick dark brown head over what is apparently motor oil. Sweet, very alcoholic nose, with quite some vanilla, and other, difficultly to place fine aromas. Speculoos liquified, spiced, peppery, speculoos herbs (cinnamon, allspice, vanilla,...) Surprising and excellent; in the finish the spices become really Tex-Mex with chilies of different kinds. Sharp, spicy, hot and yet pleasing; quite well-bodied. Mole sauce in a beerbottle. Admittedly, the contents of this bottle justifies the Florida Cigar City craze to at least some extent.  Many thanks to Evan & Matt!
Opaque black color. Small brown head. Smell coffee and roasted malts. Taste coffee, roasty, heavy and light sourness. High carbo, full body.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2011 Bottle:
Small dark brown head on top of an oily black (!) colored beer.
Smell coffee, caccao, molasses, smoke, coal, milk chocolate.
Taste coffee, coffee beans, burnt malts & barleys, lovely bitter, dark chocolate, dark fruits and spices, tar, bitter!
Nice bitter coffee darknspicy aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, full body and a nice oily texture.
Great looking beer, very well balanced and superb tasting!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle generously shared at the RBSG grand tasting. Pours black with the darkest of tan heads; absolutely beautiful pour. Aroma is rich of liquid chocolate with notes of raspberry and red pepper. The flavor is wonderfully liquid milk chocolate with a slight touch of red pepper. Mouthfeel is incredibly silky and reminiscent of "cool" hot chocolate. This is lovely, although I got more heat and sweet spice from the Bourbon Barrel Aged version.

From notes. May 2010.  HUGE thanks to Armin for this one!  Pour is a very dark brown, with a nice mocha head that fades fairly quickly.  Looks like a pretty standard IS, smells like a pretty standard....wait.  Is that chili pepper?  And vanilla? And bitter coffee, chocolate, oak, roasty goodness, all wrapped up into one snifter?  Simply sublime smelling, with all of the aromas blending perfectly, complimenting without competing. Taste suffers somewhat, as the first sip lingers and muddies the distinctive flavors in the subsequent tastes.  Finishes slightly weak compared to the way it starts.

Perfection!

Received this bottle from Chairmissing and I cant thank him enough!

A: The darkest, thickest beer Ive seen to date. Decent carbonation.

S: Coffee, chocolate and vanilla.

T: Let me start by saying I came into this beer very skeptical. I never believe the hype behind beers but this left me speechless. I let the bottle sit for about 20 minutes after taking out of the fridge, poured into a snifter. The first taste was strong chocolate and alcohol with a interesting aftertaste. As it warmed the cinnamon and chili became quite apparent. The strong chocolate hits first then some malt and to finish it off the chili hits the back of the tongue simply amzing and this is now the most complex beer Ive ever had.

O: Cant describe how much I love this beer. There is no way I will miss the release next year. I wouldnt trade away the cellar to try it but if you have a friend near the brewery or someone offering you a bottle for a decent trade definitely do it.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9,4 ounces, with Luc Bourbonnière, savoured on June 5 2011; eye: black, opaque, dark brown head that turns into a tiny ring; nose: roasted malt, dark chocolate, liquorice, light molasses, smoke, tobacco, slight burnt; mouth: roasted malt, dark chocolate, liquorice, molasses, smoke, light tobacco, light burnt, woody, finale in roasted malt with presence of dark chocolate, medium-full body, below-average carbonation, slightly sweet and bitter, slick texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, avec Luc Bourbonnière, savourée le 5 juin 2011; il : noire, opaque, mousse brune foncée qui se transforme en un très petit anneau; nez : malt torréfié, chocolat noir, réglisse, léger mélasse, fumée, tabac, très léger brûlé; bouche : malt torréfié, chocolat noir, réglisse, mélasse, fumée, léger tabac, léger brûlé, boisé, finale en malt torréfié avec présence de chocolat noir, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, très légèrement sucrée et amère, texture coulante; en résumé : bien bon
Solid pitch black in color with dark brown head. Huge spicy cinnamon aroma. Light heat from the chilies on the lips, tons of cinnamon this year. rich roasted malts, molasses, syrupy and delicious.

A super thick and oily black imperial stout with a thin brown head. In aroma, an explosion of chocolate sauce, molasses, berries, rhubarb, tobacco, and licorice. In mouth, loads of bitter chocolate and tobacco, herbal in nature, burned coffee, bitter cocoa, soy sauce, iodine, complex and intense. 750 ml shared with  GRM, Mike H and Ian G, June 5 2011.

Bottle served cold and split three ways at a small lambic themed tasting. Hunahpu pours a dark black with a small, creamy mocha head. The smell is pleasant and veggie-like with notes of celery, carrots, black pepper, and dry hot chocolate. Taste-wise I got dark, dark chocolate, spicy chili powder mid-way through, and a finish that ends like a nice boozy hot chocolate. A bit of cinnamon shows up in the background from mid-taste to finish, but it compliments the stout well. Overall, one of my favorite imperial stouts. Drink it fresh before the chili and spices fade!

Incredibly dark in color - no light getting through this one, small head - and light lacing around the glass.  Bitter chocolate aroma, slight vanilla as well.  Taste is unbelievable!!  Bitter chocolate, some vanilla with hints of coffee and some cinnamon in the finish - but not overly boozy.  Incredibly complex and unique - thanks to my beer bud for sharing this one with me!!

Deep motor-oil black color with a deeply brown head which has a nice red hue. Aroma has many interesting characteristics; Tons of vanilla, some chili, faint alcohol - well managed. Also lots of smooth chocolate, and nice, bitter coffee. Sharp but at the same time managed and subtle. Nice! Taste is extremely viscous and has loads of delightful roast, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa beans, dry chili. Extremely long duration, some booze but not too much. It has some side-notes of weird medicine-like cough syrup but it doesnt in any way harm the taste. Also pumpkin and cannabis.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a chocolate head. The aroma is malt, coffee, cold coffee, green peppers and soya. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is dry and roasted with sweetness. Overall a really good beer.

2009 Bottle courtesy of the Cheeseman. Pours as viscous as motor oil with a tan head with ruddy highlights. Smells like vanilla ice cream in a cocoa sauce spiked with red pepper. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, with a tinge of spiciness that hits the side of the tongue. Finishes long with a bite of the pepper with no hint as to the 11% alcohol bill. Truly amazing beer.

Brown black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is sour chocolate and medium coffee. Dark toasted malt with a hint of coffee, and a slight spicy/vegtable flavor. Medium full bodied with good carbonation.

2011 bottle courtesy of burg326.  Aroma is fantastic; chocolate and roast are very potent, cocoa, and sweet chocolate, almost get a note of fresh baked dense chocolate cake, caramel and molasses, vanilla.  Some hop bitterness, spicy note from the chilies, cinnamon, somewhat earthy.  

Pours like used motor oil, completely opaque, I cant even see through the stream as I pour into the glass, nice tan head which is thicker than I presumed such a beer could support, retention is only a minute or two before subsiding to a thin ring of foam.

Flavor starts off with a load of sweet chocolate and roast; the roast flavor is pleasant and mellow, not at all puckering or astringent.  Caramel and cocoa, toffee, molasses, dark sugars and some dates, dark roasted coffee, nice vanilla presence.  Cinnamon really shows up once the chocolate and roast have a second to dissipate, slight flavor from the chilies, but they show up more in the form of a nice warmth in the finish.

Very full body, thick and chewy, coats the palate and keeps the flavors lingering for quite a while.  Medium carbonation.

Just a fantastic stout, amazing how so many flavors come together and work so well, very well done!
Pours black with a brown disapearing head. Aroma is roasted malt, cold coffee, soy, green pepper, chocolate and liquorish. Flavour is roasted malt, green pepper, cold coffee and chocolate.
Black with a small light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, green peppers and chili. A vegetable and pepper note dominates the flavour, along with cloying sweet malts.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2011 Pours black with a thick dark head.  Smells of loads of chocolate, espresso, tobacco, licorice, and leather.  Cinnamon and spices catch me by surprise.  Offering flavors of decadent chocolate, heavy roasted coffee, sweet licorice, and copious lactose sugars.  The finish is long and bitter with a good roasted finish.   The peppers come in right at the finish and provide a very welcomed warming effect.  It feels more like alcohol warmth than it does a vegetal spice.  Very well done.  I was very surprised to have enjoyed this one so much.

Bottle 2011 vintage .. Jet black pour , thin beige head with wispy lace . Dark roasted malt aroma with fruit and cocoa notes . Big chocolate and roasted malt flavor , notes of cinnamon , pepper and dark fruit . Alcohol burns the lips a bit . Very complex and layered . Inky , oily slick and deliciously smooth .  Medium to full bodied , well balanced .Finish is dry with a bakers chocolate bitterness . Fantastic .

2011 Release - 25.4 oz bottle - poured into 10 oz snifter

AROMA: Dates, oak, chocolate, brown sugar, and vanilla.
APPEARANCE: Poured pitch black and thick.  Slightly more than minimal head that was dark brown in color.
TASTE: Intense flavor.  There is a lot going on here.  Chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, some bitterness, finishes slightly spicy with a lingering chocolate taste.
PALATE: Medium to full bodied, creamy, and a bit of carbonation.  Finishes spicy with some chocolate.
OVERALL:  I feel very lucky to have acquired this via trade (thanks clintonpuckett - BA).  This is the fist time that I have tried a stout with chiles in it and now this is one of my favorites.  Excellent job Cigar City!

2010 bottle tasted on 5/8/11. The pour is ridiculously thick and black with a large dark brown head. CC gets the darkest brown foam from their stouts! The aroma is lots of dark chocolate with hints of vanilla and subdued chiles. Theres also some nice dark fruit notes of dates, raisins, and cherries.  The flavor is big on dark fruity plums, raisins, cherry and lots of semi sweet dark chocolate. The vanilla and spice has faded a bit since I remember having this fresh and getting way more chile spice. I actually pick up more of a green chile flavor than spicy heat. The cinnamon still shines through very nicely. It has just a touch of soy and ashy roasted malt in the finish. This was a real treat just for the wonderfully rich chocolate character. If you like it more intense, drink it young.

Bottle shared at the CL Rosso Batch 3 Release. Quite happy to finally try this one (2011 release). Pours thick black with a dark brown head. Nose is full of chocolate and booze with a noticeable pepper aroma along with some vanilla. Very interesting taste with roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, and a bit of pepper heat. Light alcohol warmth on the finish. Such a complex and interesting beer, I absolutely must try this again.

aroma is sticky sweet and salty with chocolate espresso dominating with hints of cinammon and vanilla with other spices.  pours a tar color with a dark brown head.  taste is very chocolatey with vanilla tones and coffee.  Roasted malt combines nicely with the cinnamon which in turn goes very well with the spicy chile flavors which linger.  Palate is thick, sticky and heavy.  A great beer!
75cl Bottle. Thanks to Hallinghansen. Pours black with a creamy brown head on top. Roast, charcoal, black pepper, soy and dark fruit. Chewy, creamy and smooth. Truly nice!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Bottle thanks to bigmmartin.  Pours a nice rich black with thin tan head.  Aroma is sweet malts with notes of oatmeal, cinnamon, dark chocolate, vanilla bean, and roasted malts.  Palate is smooth and lightly carbonated.  Flavor really brings out an oatmeal.  As it warmed, I picked up on peppers as well? Pretty damn good.

Bottle thanks to bigmmartin.  Amazing beer, complex and very well done.  Wonderful nose of dark chocolate, spices, and vanilla.  Flavor is the same, little bit of burnt/smoky/roastedness in there that really sets the tongue off.  Full bodied and creamy, probably partially due to the mild carbonation, with a spicy/peppery finish.
Bottle at Dark Lord Day. Thanks for the share. Poured dark black with small head that retained. Some spicyness with cocoa, vanilla mixed in with roasty malts. Overall really good stout.

Bottle shared by Dalzale. Pours jet black with a nice mocha head. Aroma of burnt malts,coffee, a touch of hops and spice.  Taste is the same with a nice smokiness and a little bit of heat from the peppers.

Pours thick and black with a nice brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla and you get a little hint of peppers. Has a sweet taste with hints of vanilla, peppers and dark chocolate. Also a bit of coffee in there. overall a great beer.

Bottle courtesy of Northernbrews. Pours a beautiful black, with a nice brown head. Aroma is dominated by the chili peppers. Body is thick, and full. Flavor is also dominated by the peppers. Lingering pepper finish.
2011 bottle. hops, coffee, chocolate.  dark pour with a tan head. coffe caramel chocolate peppers.  great body and heat

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2012 750 ml bottle courtesy of RaffyS.  Thanks.  2012 Vintage.  Pours a pitch black with dark tan chocolate head that has good retention and leaves some light lacing on the glass.  The aroma is rich decadent chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, light coffee, and a bit of chilies.  Quite nice.  The taste is sweet chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, cocoa, a bit of coffee, and some smoked chilies.  The finish has a light bitterness and leaves a little bit of lingering heat from the peppers and a bit of roastiness. Full, creamy body with low carbonation.  Great beer.  Its definitely on the sweet side, which I usually dont enjoy, but it works here.  All the flavors come together quite nicely.  It also might have one of the best mouthfeels out of any beer.
9.5.9.4.18

750 ml bottle courtesy of J2Brew2.  Thanks Joe. 2011 release.  Pours a pitch black with a dark tan head.  Possibly the darkest beer Ive ever seen.  Barely any light gets through even at the edges.  Also the darkest head that I have seen.  Good retention and lacing.  Aroma is huge vanilla and dark chocolate as well as a little bit of cinnamon.  Phenomenal.  The initial taste is sweet with vanilla, dark chocolate, and some cinnamon.  A light smokiness and a hint of the pepper comes through in the mid palate.  The finish is very smooth with little trace of the alcohol coming through.  A bit of pepper heat comes through after swallowing.  Quite pleasant.  A big, full bodied beer.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Not syrupy a bit.  Medium-low carbonation  Pretty much everything I could ask for in a beer.  This is certainly one of the best beers that I have had.
10/5/10/5/19

My 100th cigar city rating! Pours a perfect jet black with a great brown head. Nose is good sweet vanilla, ancho chillies. Milk chocolate. Taste is good vanilla milk chocolate, faint chillies. Brown sugar. Palate is awesome, perfectly balanced. Nice heat. A pretty great beer but better on tap.

Bottle from a trade with Mashmaster. Wow, Ive been wanting to try this one for a long time, nice to finally try it. Engine oil pour with an intense brown head with a beautiful red shine. One of the most beautiful beers Ive seen. Aroma is rather sweet with fresh vanilla beans, chocolate, cocoa, cinnamon, coffee, fudge, brownie, a whiff of chili sharpness and a small hint of strawberry. A slight medicinal touch. Taste is very nice as well, loads of cocoa, roast, coffee, vanilla, rather medicinal as well, the chili becomes more evident the longer you keep it in the mouth. Very interesting, but also very very nice. But the medicinal component notched it a bit down for me. Overall a very complex and delicious beer.

Not was I was hopping for based on the hype.  Poured a dark stout color.  It is fairly obvious that the base is Marshal Zhukov but this actually is a bit better than that grog.  Taste had hints of coffee and chocolate.  ABV of 11% is well hidden.  I would like to try a BA version of this as I think it would certainly make this great.

Bottle. Pitch black with a wonderful dark reddish brown head. Very odd aroma with spicy coffee, chile and vegetable notes. The flavour is quite sweet at first with a roasted and bitter finish. It is very odd but also very interesting. Im not sure wether I like or not. I can taste the chile and vanilla, but I really the flavour has more hints of hokkaido pumpkin and medicine (cough syrup?). It is indeed very interesting, but is it good? Im not sure.....

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 2017-01-28, Sergeys hunt, released March 12th 2016, 7-4-8-3-16=38Oily black color with barely any head. Nutty and spicy aroma. Thick mouthfeel, undercarbonated, roasted malts, very heavy cinnamon and chili pepper flavor.Yes, its good, but its unbalanced and unclassy.2010-03-26, courtesy of Beershine, 7-4-8-5-16=40Black color; medium sized dark brown head. Light aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, cacao, light alcohol, very light vanilla. Thick and quite viscous mouthfeel; very strong chocolate flavor, lightly smokey, salty; light chili pepper too; tobacco; more liquorice in the end, with warming alcohol. Peculiar, very good, not easy, but bold.

This one has some hype to live up to.

Pours dead black with the most amazing cocoa head ever.

Smell is a bit off-putting. Nothing inviting here, bitter, dark hops and/or cacao.

Taste is COMPLEX. Getting cacao beans, and a healthy cinnamon burn which is amazing. Coffee roast coming through as well. Not getting a ton of vanilla. Did I mention Cinnamon and chile burn?

Wow, this is a wonderful taste. I love cinnamon and chocolate combined and this is the best of all worlds - Cinnamon, chocolate and BEER! But it works. This reminds me of the descriptions of ancient Aztec hot chocolate drinks back when the cacao bean wasnt the invention of Milton Hershey.
